        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="4535" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="4535" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">3.52</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="1103">1,103</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="166"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>Bluebell</b> by <b>Penhaligon's</b> is a Floral Green fragrance for women. <b>Bluebell</b> was launched in 1978. The nose behind this fragrance is Michael Pickthall. Top note is Citruses; middle notes are Hyacinth, Lily-of-the-Valley, Rose, Cyclamen and Jasmine; base notes are Galbanum, Cloves and Cinnamon. </p><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: <a href="https://www.fragrantica.de/Parfum/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Deutsch</a>,  <a                 </div>

                    <div class="fa-lg" style="display: flex; align-items: center; color: grey; cursor: pointer;">
                    <div style="display: inline-flex;">
                        <div class="vote-box-sp-ai">
                            <span>
                            <i class="far fa-thumbs-up"></i>

                             <span>

                            <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">12</span></div>

                    </div>
                    </div>
                    Spicy and nauseating
                </div>
                    </div>
    </div>
</div>

</fragram-photos-wrapper><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-y" id="pyramid"><div class="cell"><div style="display: flex; flex-direction: column; justify-content: center; text-align: center; background: white;"><div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Pyramid</span></div><pyramid-switch :perfume_id="4535"><pyramid-notes title="Main Notes According to Your Votes"></pyramid-notes><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Top Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="top"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.73508893593265; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.313.jpg" style="width: 2.5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Citruses-313.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Citruses</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Middle Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="middle"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.22.jpg" style="width: 5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Hyacinth-22.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Hyacinth</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.93475271741739; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.109.jpg" style="width: 3.525rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Lily-of-the-Valley-109.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Lily-of-the-Valley</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.80477139066561; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.105.jpg" style="width: 2.8rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Rose-105.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Rose</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.78283876109963; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.166.jpg" style="width: 2.7rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cyclamen-166.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Cyclamen</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.75364609430049; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.14.jpg" style="width: 2.575rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Jasmine-14.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Jasmine</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Base Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="base"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.94222822930411; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.45.jpg" style="width: 3.575rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Galbanum-45.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Galbanum</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.92323619588367; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.61.jpg" style="width: 3.45rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cloves-61.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Cloves</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.76557320030326; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.65.jpg" style="width: 2.625rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cinnamon-65.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Cinnamon</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level></pyramid-switch></div></div><div class="cell text-center"><button class="button small" data-open="NotesRatingModal">Vote for Ingredients</button></div></div><notes-rating :perfume_id="4535"></notes-rating></div><div class="cell small-12"><vue-encrypt-postscribe slotid='070a7199457ed4d1623cea799cf4677b209' slotpayload='{"ct":"DjXw5BsgR+gaTHdovwevqgjKpqqtxtEmFAMe\/VkO4qysMjLCnuBa1EP2BOZnrwxs0zo8dKWLelyqVdB0fmta7BsqY95BkaV98RCyxvY6kcmZfkNxehJ2X4h2bQeKms+5vpPFk4rwjpn4gxVUbOo3LEvwwAdU\/M8t039vcTWxAJZjtXhV94K5\/O60iN12XwmOhrLV1Lia4YCJJ8rkuuwlYFxmi9OM\/py50Cgu4G84xaa4Aklzu5Hz1AdbL9XkK2jPCwhSydm\/uO1NXWku5orHkRjwotdBM+202DZ1QESezr04NFiLcG7b8LXEcufoDOe7","iv":"b3d90e7899aa4d4ed351fad871fe4694","s":"1458b2e289fc50d3"}'></vue-encrypt-postscribe></div><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-padding-y"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_3 -->

height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 20 20" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M10 18a8 8 0 100-16 8 8 0 000 16zm1-12a1 1 0 10-2 0v4a1 1 0 00.293.707l2.828 2.829a1 1 0 101.415-1.415L11 9.586V6z"clip-rule="evenodd"></path></svg>All reviews by date</a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-positive-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2342671" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2342671" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lazulisylph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1883751"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1883751.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lazulisylph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Lilyphea-96740.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96740.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lilypha"title="Lilypha"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2342671ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2342671" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1883751">lazulisylph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-08">11/08/24 19:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very green floral; the kind that draws polarising reactions. For the most devoted floral lover. I cannot smell it too much with my nose up close to my skin (too green) but other than that, it is like a honeyed floral tea cloud. I really get a strong impression of honey and it makes my mouth water. Honeysuckle, maybe? Its not for consistent, everyday wear as my impression of it/the way that it performs seems to fluctuate at times, but I find that to be a part of its charm; its not boring. I live in a very humid and hot tropical country where it is easy to feel and be sticky, and rather than Bluebell being something that I can reach out for at any time, I really feel like I have to be in a clean and fresh state in order to wear this, or else it can smell off and sweaty very easily.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2342671"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2342671#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2318837" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2318837" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MarkoBB"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2283820"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2283820.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="MarkoBB" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2318837ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2318837" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2283820">MarkoBB</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-17">10/17/24 11:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a full bottle.. don't be afraid to message me if you are interested..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2318837"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2318837#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312746" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2312746" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maria Rosenthal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1350178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1350178.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maria Rosenthal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Heure-Bleue-Eau-de-Parfum-208.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.208.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Heure Bleue Eau de Parfum"title="L'Heure Bleue Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2312746ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2312746" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1350178">Maria Rosenthal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 18:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ode to Penhaligons Bluebell<br />
<br />
WOW, PENHALIGONSYouve truly outdone yourselves a long time ago. <br />
<br />
As a longtime happily flabbergasted owner and devoted fan of your exquisite fragrance The Favourite, Ive always been enchanted by your masterful creations. For the longest time, Bluebell has been at the top of my wishlist, and now that its finally in my hands, I can confidently say it was more than worth the wait.<br />
<br />
The moment I let out Bluebell, it was pure drop dead love at first sniff! This fragrance is everything I had hoped for and morea perfect symphony of sparkling freshness, whispering nostalgia, and an elegance worthy of the greatest Dames. The balance between the earthy, a bit dirty, green notes and the scintillating floral heart is worthy of a rare Queen Fairy - simply divine, creating a scent that is rocketed into starry, unforgettable timelessness.<br />
<br />
Theres a certain magic in Bluebell that lingers long after the first spray, and it captivates my heart soul with every wear. Its bold and searching, yet fluffy and soft, sharply classic, yet undefinable unique. I am in awe of the way it carries me, on scented angels wings, to a serene and dreamy place, with just a few sprays. <br />
<br />
From the bottom of my heart, thank you for creating this beautiful scent. Please, never stop making Bluebelland please NEVER reformulate it!! Its a true gem in your scent library and has quickly become one of my most cherished fragrances (among MANY)<br />
<br />
With endless gratitude and admiration,<br />
A devoted Penhaligons fan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2312746"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2312746#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2248497" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2248497" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Stargxzer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2026754"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2026754.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Stargxzer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2248497ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2248497" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2026754">Stargxzer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-13">08/13/24 21:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This and Lily of The Valley are sisters. While Lily of The Valley is the calmer, mature, well spoken, demure sister, Bluebell is more mysterious, free spirited, with slight edge to it. Both starts with robust green notes and floral garden, but Bluebell is dirtier in the opening, like the bluebells are directly ripped from the soil. Somehow Bluebell is poignant and lachrymose. I love it, I think Bluebell is not like the usual feminine floral, but not trying so bad to be different. She is just the way she is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2248497"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2248497#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2242775" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2242775" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dreamypepper"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1798718"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1798718.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dreamypepper" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4535.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bluebell"title="Bluebell"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2242775ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2242775" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1798718">dreamypepper</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-08">08/08/24 09:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>surprised by the powdery scent i haven't seen mentioned! it's unlike many perfumes i have tried, due its accurate replication of the scent of the wilds. one thing i really love about this perfume is that it is very green- it truly smells like i'm outside, among trees and flowers. this is the exact effect i was looking for, so i'm very pleased :) its also possible my skin chemistry just makes it this way, but it has such a lovely effect!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->
<div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2241523" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2241523" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lostnose2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1933834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1933834.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lostnose2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2241523ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2241523" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1933834">lostnose2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-07">08/07/24 04:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The name and the color intrigued me enough to make a blind buy for my wife. Had not read the reviews. Now that I read the reviews,  it seems off. So polarizing.  Either you love it or hate it. For me, I love when she wears it. It stands out. Bright floral with a bit of mystery and come-hither smell. It always catches me when she decides to use it. I think it is great. A little pricey. If there is a dupe with the same intrigue, I would grab it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2241523"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2241523#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2233644" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2233644" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gileshowe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/62956"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.62956.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gileshowe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2233644ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2233644" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/62956">Gileshowe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-30">07/30/24 07:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Yesterday: green, stemmy, hyacynth, springtime in the English countryside. Today, a cockroach's nest treated with insecticide. It goes both ways. Nice used as a room fragrance in a pale, minimalist room. Nice-ish sprayed lightly on clothes. Horrible when sprayed heavy handedly. Can see how this works on a lady but on a man this isn't so good beyond as a fabric refresher.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2233644"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2233644#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2213415" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2213415" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jaynemansfield"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1864613"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1864613.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jaynemansfield" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2213415ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2213415" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1864613">jaynemansfield</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-09">07/09/24 16:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can see why this perfume is so polarising. Im unsure of my opinion on it, to be honest. When I first sprayed it all I was smelling was alcohol, but eventually it does open up. As others have mentioned, its veryyyy garden-y. After its been on the skin for a while the floral notes make an appearance. However, overall its a very sharp citrus leaning fragrance that very nearly borders on unwearable for me. Im not sure if Id ever feel comfortable wearing this around other people. Its very unique, and I do appreciate the vibe its going for. Yet its vastly different to what Im used to, and isnt what I look for in a scent.<br />
<br />
That said, after smelling this and Elisabethan Rose from Penhaligons collection Im very keen to sample the other perfumes they have for sale.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2213415"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2213415#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2200887" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2200887" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="peter.frost"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/986834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="peter.frost" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Sartorial-10559.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10559.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sartorial"title="Sartorial"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2200887ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2200887" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/986834">peter.frost</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-27">06/27/24 05:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful bright floral fragrance that I enjoy wearing on hotter days. It's cuts through the heat. I've never had any negative comments. It's the only hyacinth scent I can do. I think it's the gorgeous base notes that take this floral to another level. There's nothing not to like. Cannot understand the negative reviews. Definitely a more feminine scent but men can carry it off too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2200887"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2200887#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2188188" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2188188" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pocketfullofposies"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1479013"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1479013.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pocketfullofposies" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2188188ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2188188" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1479013">pocketfullofposies</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-14">06/14/24 12:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the most disappointed Ive been with a fragrance because Ive been wanting to try this for ages. But I just cannot stand it!<br />
The first few seconds gives you a gorgeous green scent but it quickly turns into something rather unpleasant. It reminds me of dirt and damp and it makes me a bit nauseous. I was hoping for an alternative to Wild Bluebell by Jo Malone as that is beautiful but lasts 5 minutes. I think I got a bit desperate and didnt look past the name.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2188188"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2188188#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2185891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2185891" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="greydove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/46434"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.46434.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="greydove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/Angel-Muse-36416.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.36416.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Angel Muse"title="Angel Muse"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2185891ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2185891" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/46434">greydove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-12">06/12/24 07:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Haha! The reviews on this are so weird. "Thanks!" Fragrantica, for keeping me away from this for years :/ Reading these comments, you would think this is awful, stuffy and old fashioned. Clove? Dirt? Where!? Maybe the vintage versions? Instead, its the prettiest cold, fresh, blossomy floral. All petals and water droplets. Stunning. Don't always trust the reviews on here! The color is awesome too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2185891"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2185891#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2147383" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2147383" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hgf2008"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2032817"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hgf2008" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2147383ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2147383" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); Unique and quite pleasant but not what I would have imagined before spraying. Oddly, for that reason, I think it's probably more appropriate for the colder months (at least on me) as it's more warming and comforting than it is refreshing. Maybe one for damp February days...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2147383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2147383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2140613" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; If you're Kate Bush-ian, this is going to suit you and you'll get compliments </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2117482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2117482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2107885" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2107885" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GracieLions"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821289"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1821289.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="GracieLions" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Mojave-Ghost-27040.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.27040.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mojave Ghost"title="Mojave Ghost"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2107885ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2107885" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821289">GracieLions</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 08:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>You need to wait for this to dry down! The opening is very pungent and reminiscent of a vase of flowers that's been out for weeks. However, half an hour after you've sprayed it, it evolves into a general, and beautiful, floral. It layers exceptionally well with an orange blossom fragrance of your choice (I like Penhaligon's Orange Blossom), or with just one spritz of Dior J'adore L'Or. Good luck!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2107885"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2107885#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2106225" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2106225" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="daisy366"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1894781"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1894781.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="daisy366" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2106225ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2106225" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1894781">daisy366</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-27">03/27/24 16:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wish I paid more attention to the comments about this not being a modern smell before I bought it. Bluebell is 100% a vintage smell!!! <br />
It reminds me a lot of Zoologists Moth, which also has notes of cinnamon, clove, jasmine, rose, lily of the valley, and citrus. Moth, however, is smokey and slightly woody. Bluebell is not smokey or woody. <br />
Bluebell is very pungent and heavy. I tried to layer it with a few other perfumes, but it overpowered everything I sprayed over it. Im really not sure how I feel about it. I dont think I could wear this indoors.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2106225"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2106225#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2092891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2092891" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="silvakuro"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1866093"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1866093.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="silvakuro" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2092891ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2092891" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1866093">silvakuro</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-14">03/14/24 20:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm surprised that the sillage is not as strong as I expected for such a thick fragrance. I immediately smell the citrus and the green, but not in a leafy sense. This reminds me of fresh flower bouquet made mostly of lilies early in the morning. What comes in mind is the yellow pollen grains that's just always gonna' rub off on your precious items.<br />
<br />
I don't really sense the rose and the longer you wear it, the green keeps on expanding and getting warmer, which is an interesting turn for me. I think I'll wear this for specific events only, like weddings or baby shower.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2092891"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2092891#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2062898" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2062898" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carlitagp"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303690"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carlitagp" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2062898ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2062898" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303690">Carlitagp</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-15">02/15/24 05:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Snapped stalks, peculiarly ethereal yet pungunt hyacinth and the fleshy, orange flower / melon-like clarity of cyclamen are hiding beneath a cloak of early morning mist. Pierced by dawns break: a carpet of bluebells shivers awake</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2062898"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2062898#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2057650" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2057650" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cogniaux"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1287960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1287960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cogniaux" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/MDCI-Parfums/Chypre-Palatin-15130.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15130.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chypre Palatin"title="Chypre Palatin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2057650ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2057650" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); I think it needs to breathe in the bottle for a while. Lasts all day and smells lovely. Along with Ostara its one of my favourite spring perfumes that reminds me of the heavy smell of hyacinths and jonquils.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2057650"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2057650#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2047234" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; As it dries down after roughly an hour it begins to smell differently and is mostly pleasant. Not a safe blind buy and not office friendly. Especially advise against wearing this on a date. This one will be reserved for when I'm puttering around the yard doing gardening and lawn care.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="2047234"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=2047234#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2008715" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; To me It's Very generic floral powdery  perfume with  spicy and herbal twist here and there. It is not bad but there is nothing niche about it. If it were a 15/20 dollars perfume nevermind, even if it were 60/70 dollars  I would have rated it far better. You can buy better  smelling fragrances at half of the price. I received it as a gift so i don't have any regret. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966398" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HopeEliza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1854653"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1854653.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HopeEliza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); So disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1966398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1966398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1961269" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1961269" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Miss_Alice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1421586"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1421586.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Miss_Alice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1961269ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1961269" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1421586">Miss_Alice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-26">10/26/23 05:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very beautiful perfume. This perfume smells niche. It smells ancient. To me it has a similar depth and crispness of Gucci Envy. It has a crisp earthiness to it that is so realistic and natural and smooth yet it is not sweet nor aquatic. It has a silvery, metallic addictic juicy quality to it. A masterpiece. Haunting. Beautiful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1961269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1961269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1902142" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1902142" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GirlOnFire"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231923"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="GirlOnFire" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rochas/Byzance-1423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Byzance"title="Byzance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1902142ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1902142" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231923">GirlOnFire</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 13:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I actually like Bluebell, but it should be said that if youre looking for something like the aquatic Jo Malone Wild Bluebell, look elsewhere. The beauty of Penhaligons Bluebell is its earthiness. This smells of bluebells in the damp soil, with dew-dropped leaves and stems. It is not a modern perfume, so keep that in mind, but its beautiful. Its a little bit musty, like a well-loved medieval English cottage with a lush garden and a pond.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1902142"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1902142#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1858575" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1858575" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ROUSAK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/34561"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ROUSAK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1858575ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1858575" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1837258" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fitofrage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1622790"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1622790.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fitofrage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1837258ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1837258" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1622790">fitofrage</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-19">05/19/23 15:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do get the odd synthetic note others have mentioned, but I love the hyacinth note so much that Ill keep wearing it. The synthetic note seems to stay really close to the skin, whereas the hyacinth projects. So as long as my nose it at arms length, its beautiful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1837258"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1837258#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1808222" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1808222" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Natalia.ca"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1721909"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1721909.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Natalia.ca" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Gabrielle-43718.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43718.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gabrielle"title="Gabrielle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1808222ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1808222" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1721909">Natalia.ca</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-13">04/13/23 18:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its completely unusual.<br />
For me it smells of green insects.<br />
Maybe a pond when its pouring rain?<br />
Earth? Damp earth with crushed insects beside a pond in the rain.<br />
Sorry, its the best I can do.<br />
You want to smell like it? Got the water nymph vibes? Go ahead.<br />
I keep mine because its so unusual its a curiosity, and I like to have it in my collection.<br />
Somewhere I read Lady Di used to wear it. I highly doubt that. Maybe when she was depressed married to Charles?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1808222"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1808222#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1791300" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1791300" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mother Nurgle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1177401"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1177401.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mother Nurgle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zoologist-Perfumes/Harvest-Mouse-78580.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.78580.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Harvest Mouse"title="Harvest Mouse"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1791300ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1791300" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1177401">Mother Nurgle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-24">03/24/23 00:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I expected an initial blast of hyacinth, but its really not that noticable. Instead I got botanical, sharp and bitter. After half an hour it dries down to a comforting and almost dry bluebell (or at least thats how I expect bluebells to smell - reminds me of Jo Malones). No sweetness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1791300"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1791300#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1790832" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1790832" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Muki Yair"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1653244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1653244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Muki Yair" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Empressa-Eau-de-Parfum-67818.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67818.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Empressa Eau de Parfum"title="Empressa Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1790832ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1790832" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1653244">Muki Yair</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-23">03/23/23 12:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>after a very long wait I finally got my Bluebell and i'm totally in love with it!<br />
it is a very unusual and unique , and a blend of unexpected  scents.<br />
<br />
starts off very strong with citruses and a blast of hyacinth so powerful you feel you have landed in a sea of flowers , the dry down leaves a delicate cloud of flowers floating around and a delicate clove giving a very fresh feeling, and the galbanum that gives out a very earthy watery atmosphere .<br />
<br />
the scents are very natural and do give a feeling of being out in nature after the rain in the beginning of spring in  a very english garden while the hyacinth is blooming.<br />
<br />
I can say i fell in love with this perfume and find it addictive<br />
I will definitely get more of it in the future</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1790832"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1790832#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1783305" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
