Unwearable (for me that is). I am not saying this is horrible, clearly it delights many people, but I sniffed it twice and was utterly repulsive. I dont even know what it was but it really clashed with my sense of smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1767569"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1767569#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1688648" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1688648" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ursulaburns"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504075"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1504075.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ursulaburns" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Demeter-Fragrance/Almond-7763.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.7763.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Almond"title="Almond"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1688648ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1688648" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1504075">ursulaburns</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-15">11/15/22 01:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhallagon's Bluebell is my spring....the scent that marks the freshness of new growth and a anticipation of the bluebell woods. It is a frequency! A sharp light green and blue that cuts through the harshness of winter and promises that warmer days are coming. You can still feel the cold but there is light. It captures the bluebell woods. I have been wearing in spring for 2 years now and after the first year I got a whiff of something synthetic in the opening. This was invisible to me in the first year. Now I get it. Now I pair with Demeter Lilac to mask the synthetic opening.The lilac dies down quickly and the soft bluebell lingers. Aquamarine and sapphires sparkle in a haze of the aura. It lifts a promise from an unfurling flower and blows a kiss of whispers into the April wind. Blue bell has an angelic quality that is now a ritual for my spring. I cannot live with out it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1688648"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1688648#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1607871" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1607871" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JosetteM"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1251258"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1251258.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JosetteM" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Meteorites-4045.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4045.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Meteorites"title="Meteorites"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1607871ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1607871" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1368017">Clem1982</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-25">06/25/22 12:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got this as a free sample with another penhaligons order. The opening of citrus with hyacinth is pretty awful, it settles a bit and then smells very much like a real hyacinth, admittedly one thats gone over and will be ready for the compost bin soon. I found it somewhat indolic and had to wash it off (it did not go easily either, so on that basis Id assume its long lasting)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1591273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1591273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1554092" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1554092" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MarinaJade"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1168240"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1168240.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MarinaJade" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/Lazy-Sunday-Morning-20542.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20542.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lazy Sunday Morning"title="Lazy Sunday Morning"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1554092ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1554092" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1168240">MarinaJade</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-30">04/30/22 11:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I get the bug spray but to me it's like the nice nostalgic kind (I'm 27) mixed with dove bar soap. I'm more of a feelings perfume wearer opposed to the actual scent.... So while I neither like or dislike the scent this reminds me of happy times camping and playing around the campground with my friends. Having fun in spite of the mosquitos lol and waking up in the morning in a damp tent you could still smell it on your skin while walking down to the shower house on a cold quiet morning in your jammies</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1537208" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Copperhead"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1482850"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1482850.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Copperhead" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1537208ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1537208" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1482850">Copperhead</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-05">04/05/22 06:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Princess Diana standing in a wet garden on a grey, foggy morning in the English countryside</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1537208"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1537208#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1527417" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1527417" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alphairone"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213298"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1213298.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alphairone" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Claudio-La-Viola/La-Lettera-Da-43914.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43914.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Lettera Da..."title="La Lettera Da..."></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1527417ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1527417" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213298">alphairone</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-21">03/21/22 06:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I smell hyacinths in all their full, unfettered glory here with Bluebell. Their unapologetic stemmy, sharp greenness that opens the senses, the dewy, floral splendor, and their spicy, cinnamic undertones. I find it to be the ultimate hyacinth soliflore, which may very well be off-putting to those who may want their hyacinth to be tamed and relegated to supporting player, maybe even a walk-on appearance. <br />
<br />
Here it steals the show, for better or worse, but for that I adore it. I truly believe some folks may not have had the pleasure of experiencing hyacinths and their fragrance up close and personal, or maybe they would be put off by them and therefore be put off by Bluebell, which is all fine and good. Stop sniffing hyacinth-centric scents, then. It may not necessarily be the fragrance, it may just be youLuca! In all seriousness, if it were just Princess Diana and me who enjoyed Bluebell, then I'd just be fine with that. Happy Spring!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1527417"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1527417#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1467468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1467468" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="its.me.aubree"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="its.me.aubree" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1467468ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1467468" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1205719">its.me.aubree</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-20">12/20/21 19:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I hate this fragrance. It's a sopping wet garden smell with something like a metallic twang and it's extremely off-putting to the point that I gave up exploring the rest of the house entirely. No one likes this on me and I don't like it whatsoever either. It feels like a garden where something has just gone terribly wrong and cannot be repaired, furthermore you are alone. It's an incredibly lonely smelling scent to me, which is fitting as no one should be forced to be around someone wearing this. Presentation is amazing which is why it is still on my shelf but I'd rather wear nothing than ever open this bottle again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1467468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1467468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1460438" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1460438" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cogniaux"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1287960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1287960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cogniaux" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/MDCI-Parfums/Chypre-Palatin-15130.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15130.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chypre Palatin"title="Chypre Palatin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1460438ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1460438" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1287960">Cogniaux</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-09">12/09/21 10:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A great spring perfume. This smells the most like Hyacinths of any perfume i have ever owned. A little goes a long way with this so be careful not to overspray. I wear this when Im feeling pensive and delicate</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1460438"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1460438#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1459317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1459317" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="winonahb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1204958"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1204958.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="winonahb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1459317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1459317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1204958">winonahb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-07">12/07/21 16:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The weird note others have mentioned comes across strong. It's almost unbearable straight out of the bottle. I'm reminded of the fish sandwiches at a fast food franchise I used to work at. Based on other reviews, I gave it a chance and sprayed it on my skin. An hour or so later, the fishy edge is nearly gone and it smells more like soap. Hyacinth, green notes, and soap, with a touch of fish sandwich. Now I'm wondering if there's a chemical in it some people can smell that others can't, like in cilantro, because I just can't love this perfume due to that weird breaded fish smell.<br />
<br />
Update: That strange scent is still overpowering, even when I spray it into the air to wear it. I'm giving up on it. I wish I knew whether this is a bad bottle or my theory about chemicals only some people could smell is correct. The fact that other reviews mention this smell makes me think it isn't the maker's fault or the effect of degradation. I can't enjoy it, so there's no point in wearing it.<br />
<br />
I asked my husband again what it smelled like to him. He liked it before and still likes it now, and says it smells like violet candies. We normally have a more similar impression of how things smell, so I'm willing to bet on my theory about a chemical that not all people can detect.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1459317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1459317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1457099" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1457099" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Greenly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1408086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Greenly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4535.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bluebell"title="Bluebell"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1457099ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1457099" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1408086">Greenly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-04">12/04/21 03:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was a blind buy that turned out to be a fabulous choice. It is an usual floral. Very distinct and memorable. The citrus and green keep the hyacinth from being sickly sweet. A little goes a long way and I doubt I will ever finish the bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1457099"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1457099#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1452475" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1452475" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MaquiLab"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1254834.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MaquiLab" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1452475ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1452475" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1254834">MaquiLab</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-26">11/26/21 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After smelling Jo Malone's bluebell I was expecting something similar - fairytale like and ephervescent. Penhaigon's take is sadly nothing like it. It's strong, even pungent. After an hour or so the initial blast fades away giving way to hyacynths which tend to have this strange, frowsty smell (in real life and in the perfume). I must say I haven't smelled bluebells so my expectations might be a bit off and definitely set by JM's cologne.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1452475"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1452475#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1438320" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1438320" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Suavis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1408750"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1408750.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Suavis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Electimuss/Puritas-61822.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61822.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Puritas"title="Puritas"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1438320ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1438320" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1408750">Suavis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-01">11/01/21 10:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Walking through a carpet of bluebells in Spring is truly  magical. These ephemeral flowers are incredibly fragrant, delicate and beautiful.<br />
This year I came across the most amazing bluebell field ever, I had to lie down to absorb all the goodness, it felt soooo good. Later on I started looking for a fragrance that could replicate the same aroma and discovered Penhaligonsfirst, I got a sample and my goodness!!! It was like smelling the whole bluebell field again, instant smile on my face. Got the 100ml bottle which Im sure will last a long while.<br />
Sillage and longevity are impressive, if I didnt know this is an EDT, I would definitely think its an EDP.<br />
I can easily detect bluebells (or hyacinth), Lilly of the valley, rose and cloves. Spring in a bottle, beautiful.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1438320"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1438320#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1422661" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1422661" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sabahstan3000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396771"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1396771.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sabahstan3000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Philosophy/Pure-Grace-4854.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4854.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pure Grace"title="Pure Grace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1422661ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1422661" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1396771">sabahstan3000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-05">10/05/21 09:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Extremely green and watery - smells just like fresh cut flowers. Wonderful if that's your thing, I'll use it up in the summer months but I won't repurchase.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1422661"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1422661#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1420704" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1420704" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dsty"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/781639"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.781639.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dsty" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pierre-Guillaume-Paris/Praline-de-Santal-12143.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12143.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Praline de Santal"title="Praline de Santal"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1420704ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1420704" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/781639">dsty</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-02">10/02/21 04:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This classic scent has been on my test list for ages, and now that a sample made its way into my hands, I have to say I'm not disappointed. It's a super realistic almost one-note floral scent; it's absolutely true to the fragrance not of bluebell (as far as I know), but of hyacinth: a little spicy, rather cold, earthy-green, with the specific, subtle sweetness of the real flower.  This is a scent I know and love; it's early-spring-like but also christmassy to me, as I often have hyacinths around the house at that time of year (and then on the balcony a few months later, among the first blooms of the year). <br />
I love the idea of being able to wear that scent as a perfume; at least in this high quality way it's been executed by Penhaligon's: it's elegant and clean but not light or lacking in substance, and it lasts all day. It could be worn almost year-round, except maybe in summer: it works well right now in early autumn, for instance, but I imagine its best time would be the time of the real flower, winter and early  spring.<br />
So I definitely love it, but as I generally don't reach for floral scents very often a big decant would probably last me a lifetime. It's a pity in a way, because I love the look of that classic bottle as well, and would like to add one to my collection one day. Maybe I'll find another Penhaligon's that's just as good but more my usual style!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1420704"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1420704#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1331002" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1331002" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lcprickett"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1315318"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1315318.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lcprickett" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83483.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Goddess"title="Goddess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1331002ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1331002" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1315318">Lcprickett</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-23">04/23/21 14:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was extremely spicy from opening to finish. I so wanted to love this but it smelled like super spicy bug spray. I seriously got no florals whatsoever. I looked up the batch number and its legit... if you love spicy frags then youll love this but definitely didnt agree with me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1331002"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1331002#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1315313" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1315313" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tandem_4x4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/713693"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.713693.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tandem_4x4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rouge-Bunny-Rouge/Incognito-29098.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29098.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Incognito"title="Incognito"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1315313ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1315313" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/713693">tandem_4x4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-28">03/28/21 04:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I understand it is a masterpiece, but for me it smells saliva in a beginning. Weird, and I can not like it even if I want.<br />
<br />
EDIT: if you can wait for a while, then the fragrance become a very cold first flowers growing at the spring with ice water coming from the hills. It actually is rather long lasting. Arrogant and distant.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1315313"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1315313#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1294942" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1294942" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="labonvie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40255"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.40255.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="labonvie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-Dusita/Splendiris-54863.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54863.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Splendiris"title="Splendiris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1294942ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1294942" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/40255">labonvie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-18">02/18/21 14:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think this fragrance has been unfairly maligned. Ive seen some pretty scathing reviews of this one, on Fragrantica and other sites. Really, really negative reviews. I love green fragrances and hyacinth, so I was willing to take the risk.  Im glad I did.  <br />
<br />
I do detect a certain chemical aroma initially, but I can say the same for many fragrances. And, in the case of Bluebell, it lasts all of 30 seconds.<br />
After that another note (that others may find objectionable) develops, one of fresh and fertile soil.  This lasts a bit longer (20-30 minutes) and only close to the skin.  Personally, I dont find it the least bit objectionable. At this stage, it smells a bit like the gardening department at Home Depot. From there, I get a naturalistic, slightly aquatic hyacinth.  This stage is really lovely and for the next 3 hours I get wafts of a fresh and spicy floral.  As it dries down, the clove is very prominent on my skin, but it works.  <br />
<br />
If you like green florals or hyacinth, at least give this an honest try.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1294942"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1294942#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1294435" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1294435" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EllaDe7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305609"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1305609.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="EllaDe7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Gabrielle-43718.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43718.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gabrielle"title="Gabrielle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1294435ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1294435" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305609">EllaDe7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-17">02/17/21 17:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me the Bluebell which has green note as first note is less green than the Penhaligon Lily of Valley which has a white flower note as first note.<br />
Though I am all the way a Lily of the Valley fan, I like Bluebell more.<br />
For these two flowers lovers, you should try both. <br />
Bluebell is for me a nice simple clean floral smell, just like the flower itself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1294435"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1294435#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1287046" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1287046" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cherylaf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/561850"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.561850.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cherylaf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Cloud-50384.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50384.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cloud"title="Cloud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1287046ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1287046" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/561850">cherylaf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-04">02/04/21 11:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It was confusing to me and I'm not sure if I hate it or love it.  <br />
<br />
Sharp green note right off the bat and mellows out but never fully. Smells like dryer sheets and singed plastic. It's definitely something to be experienced but I don't think I'll be purchasing a full bottle.<br />
<br />
Stays really close to the skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1287046"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1287046#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1246011" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
PS a real English bluebell(Hyacinthoides non-scripta) smells delightful with traces of honey-sweet, hyacinth is very pungent like a musky spiced bomb aka Bluebell here;) 77%Vol.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Then of course since it is a niche I tried to pretend and convince myself I liked it all through half a bottle, but really.... after half a bottle you cannot lie to yourself anymore. <br />
