It was a blind buy and an expensive mistake for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1193646"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1193646#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1129709" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1129709" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="istara"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1220821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="istara" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1129709ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1129709" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1220821">istara</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-31">12/31/19 21:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this. It is very hyacinthy/bluebelly, but there's a very strong clove note too (think stocks/Matthiola). However overall it's more cool and fresh than spicy.<br />
<br />
Extremely strong and long-lasting, be sparing at first until you know how it's going to last on your skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1129709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1129709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1102766" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1102766" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carrillatta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005897"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1005897.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carrillatta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/First-776.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.776.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="First"title="First"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1102766ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1102766" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005897">Carrillatta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-01">10/01/19 07:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do love this one, it is unique, strong and long-lasting. Hyacinth is very much a spring flower but I like this in the fall just as well. Nice and green.  Totally different from anything else in my (large) collection.<br />
<br />
Is it a crowd-pleaser?  I don't care much.  I wear this to work on days when I have a lot of writing to get done and feel a need for solitude.  It is my "leave me alone, I am going to be awesome today" perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1102766"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1102766#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1063963" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1063963" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="halogencat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150280"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1150280.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="halogencat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marks-Spencer/White-Coconut-66988.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66988.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Coconut"title="White Coconut"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1063963ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1063963" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1150280">halogencat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-25">05/25/19 12:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was so surprised to see how strongly opinion's divided by this scent, it's one of my favourites, so nostalgic and beautiful and perfect at this time of year. <br />
<br />
The opening is definitely damp, and there is a dirtiness to it, which I could understand being offputting, but it gives me that real "forest floor" scent alongside the heavy wet greenery and spicy woods. There always is the smell of decay along with new life in natural landscapes, and particularly in woodland.  <br />
The heart is lovely, intoxicating florals - hyacinth, rose, and lily-of-the-valley, and a strong bitterness, which reminds me of almonds, but not sweet gourmand almonds. Of course I've never smelt cyanide but I've heard it smells of almonds and this is the note I'd imagine it being. Florals linger for a long time along with resin and spices on the skin - somewhat counter-intuitively, the spices are light and fresh rather than warm and rich, providing a counterpoint to the very powdery base you'd typically find in a fragrance with a heart like this. <br />
The whole thing is by turns bitter, sweet, sour and spicy, which is I think one of the reasons I find it so hypnotic, there's always another layer despite fairly clear constituent notes. <br />
<br />
I think all the dirty, potentially offputting parts of the scent keep it from being too fussy and sterile - you could cut the filth and you'd have a very boring, clean rosy scent or you can have what it is, which is an adventurous, complex fragrance that captures the romance and also the threat of the forest all in one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1063963"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1063963#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1054754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1054754" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Wednesdaychild41"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191239"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1191239.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Wednesdaychild41" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Papillon-Artisan-Perfumes/Epona-95954.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95954.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Epona"title="Epona"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1054754ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1054754" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1191239">Wednesdaychild41</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-26">04/26/19 16:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>. . . No<br />
<br />
Don't like it. It honestly reminds me of a damp dusty dirty bathroom that has been sprayed with a cheap floral toilet spray.<br />
<br />
You do get the bluebell/ hyacinth note on the first spray and it starts out a delicate floral. . But on me it quicky turned into the negative description above.<br />
<br />
I so wanted to love this, as I love bluebells, and honestly the bottle shouts Alice in Wonderland which I love. <br />
<br />
But it's a thumbs down unfortunately</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1054754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1054754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1049642" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1049642" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zhiang0113"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1173932.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="zhiang0113" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bath-Body-Works/Vanilla-Romance-96320.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96320.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Romance"title="Vanilla Romance"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1049642ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1049642" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173932">zhiang0113</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-10">04/10/19 07:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very green, bitter scent. Unfortunately triggers my gag reflex when smelled up close.<br />
<br />
At a distance, when catching wafts of it, it's a lot more pleasant; clean, green, fresh with hints of floral notes - definitely less bitter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1049642"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1049642#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent995525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc995525" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellme11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1070151.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellme11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oriza-L-Legrand/Empire-des-Indes-72955.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72955.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Empire des Indes"title="Empire des Indes"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma995525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd995525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070151">smellme11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-28">10/28/18 10:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'll have to give this a 6/10 rating. Hyacinth is my favorite flower and is rarely used in perfumery. Bluebell does indeed get the hyacinth note right, but the addition of the spices (cinnamon and cloves) along with the rose note, steers this in a direction I'm not particularly fond of. I bought the smaller 50ml bottle, and am glad I didn't get the larger version.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="995525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=995525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent978490" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc978490" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="breatheme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1145959"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="breatheme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juicy-Couture/Eau-de-Couture-3781.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3781.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau de Couture"title="Eau de Couture"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma978490ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd978490" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1145959">breatheme</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-04">09/04/18 02:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Only tested it instore.<br />
<br />
It starts off very sharp and synthetic green to me and for me, even after an hour, it never really improves markedly. Sure it turned a little spicy-green but the extremely synthetic scent never went away. I actually felt nauseous from it!<br />
<br />
Interestingly, I wasn't able to remove ALL of it with makeup remover and sprayed a fairly generic perfume on top (DKNY Be Delicious) to see if I could disguise it. The two scents actually blended together very nicely (DKNY BD is usually a bit boring for me but Bluebell added an interesting powdery-green base??)<br />
<br />
This IS a very expensive perfume though, so using it solely as a layering perfume might seem a bit wasteful. If you bought blindly and dislike it, perhaps layering it over a more "generic" fruity/sweet perfume you're trying to get rid of will create a very interesting and unique blend.<br />
<br />
If you're thinking of it, try it on your skin before proceeding.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="978490"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=978490#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent969204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc969204" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Alces Alces"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068731"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1068731.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Alces Alces" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Senteurs-Gourmandes/Tendre-Madeleine-43168.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43168.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tendre Madeleine"title="Tendre Madeleine"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma969204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd969204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1068731">Alces Alces</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-08-06">08/06/18 15:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Do not blind buy this one. You need to smell it and wear it to determine whether it will work for you. Also, do not judge on first impressions. The opening is bizarre, like the smell in a tire store, or tyre store since it's an English fragrance. Just a sharp concentration of bitter green floral notes. Give it at least fifteen minutes to warm up on your skin - Bluebell will open up and reveal a lovely wet green spicy crunchy scent like hyacinths.<br />
<br />
Penhaligon's Ostara is all about daffodils to the extreme. Penhaligon's Bluebell is all about hyacinth to the tenth power. What other nuclear soliflores does Penhaligon's offer? I need to investigate this line a bit more.<br />
<br />
It's a rainy day here in the extreme heat of Texas dog days, so this wet green scent seemed like a good choice. I always think of the second season of the British crime drama "Broadchurch" when I wear this because of the bluebells. We have a flower called bluebell here in central TX, but it's not even related to English bluebells - which are relatives of hyacinths. You have to be a hardcore old school floral lover to tolerate Bluebell, but I am one and I love it, especially on rainy cool days.<br />
<br />
Moderate sillage and great longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="969204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=969204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent958916" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc958916" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mlrd217"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1123982"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1123982.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mlrd217" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Honour-Woman-12762.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12762.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Honour Woman"title="Honour Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma958916ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd958916" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1123982">mlrd217</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-05">07/05/18 13:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wasn't sure about this perfume based on reviews from Fragrantica, reading toilet cleaner and saliva, that didn't sound so good, but I was so curious so I bought a bottle. It is unexpectedly good! I thought it would smell sharp, harsh, too green (Like EL Pleasure which I dislike). The opening is very green, similar to the opening of Guerlain Chamade but it turn to a lovely, fresh, beautiful bouquet of flowers quickly. I've never smelled bluebell flower, in my nose this perfume reminds me to a funeral home or flowery garden when there's a lot of fresh flower. It's a strong perfume with moderate sillage and very long lasting. It is unique and beautiful! I will definitely buy this perfume again when this bottle is gone!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="958916"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=958916#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent934016" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc934016" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PaulieDoodle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/843886"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.843886.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="PaulieDoodle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Estee-Lauder/White-Linen-542.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.542.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Linen"title="White Linen"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma934016ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd934016" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/843886">PaulieDoodle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-04-18">04/18/18 08:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oooooooooooo Bluebell O Bluebell How I Absolutely Love You!!<br />
<br />
This was a blind buy for me &amp; I was very hesitant about purchasing it due to some of the reviews on "Fragrantica" But im actually so glad that I took the chance &amp; bought it!! This is pure springtime in a bottle,&amp; it captures a woodland meadow/forest perfectly indeed after a heavy rainshower &amp; when the sun comes back out!! Imagine gorgeous Bluebell Flowers wet with droplets of rain sitting all over them sparkling like glass beads in the warm sunlight,think of their green wet stems &amp; leaves surrounded with tuffs of grass,fern,moss &amp; the woody floor which their roots are happily growning in ALL perfectly captured in a beautiful Penhalagons Perfume Bottle!! This Fragrance is SOooooooooo different to any I own in my perfume collection,&amp; the perfume smells so real It's absolutely amazing!! It starts of with a sparkling Citrus smell,Which soon fades to the beautiful smell of real Bluebell Flowers,their stems/leaves etc after a shower of rain!! Add to that a fresh green cut Grass aroma followed by Fern,Moss &amp; damp Forest earth,mingled with beautiful Lily Of The Valley &amp; some wild rambling Rose followed by some Clove &amp; Cinnamon to give the base some mystery &amp; depth &amp; basically You've got Penhaligons Bluebell!! This is only the second day that I've wore/tried out my Bluebell edt &amp; I can honestly say six compliments already including my Mother!!This Penhaligons Perfume is wore &amp; loved by Her Majesty The Queen &amp; it actually carries her Royal Crest &amp; Also the then Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher!! A real beauty perfect for a Misty Rainy Day,The First Sign Of Spring Or Summer,or when you just want that gorgeous shower fresh up-lifting green freshness this perfume brings!! Absolutely gorgeous &amp; well worth a try!! I most certainly will be purchasing this from now on!! Over the moon with it!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="934016"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=934016#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent913084" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc913084" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11492"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11492.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Putain-des-Palaces-4521.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4521.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Putain des Palaces"title="Putain des Palaces"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma913084ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd913084" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11492">Mim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-18">02/18/18 11:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was very much afraid of this perfume. Reading all the toilet, swamp water and saliva comparisons, I didn't want to have anything to do with it. However, being a Penhaligon's lover, I got it as a gift. It is a very unusual, natural fragrance. To me, it smells somehow Gothic, like a perfume made for a witch. <br />
I smell some fresh bluebells with stems, roots and leaves. Nothing too pretty but very realistic, I would say. Also, I get a fair amount of wet soil and moist air in this one. This note resembles the smell of stale vase water, but the result isn't as bad as I would expect it (it seems that it only adds to the fragrance's authenticity). Staying power is above 10 hours on my skin; sillage is moderate for the first few hours. Lovely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="913084"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=913084#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent910630" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc910630" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="coltranedreams"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/964558"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.964558.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="coltranedreams" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sylvaine-Delacourte/Smeraldo-41845.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41845.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Smeraldo"title="Smeraldo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma910630ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd910630" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/964558">coltranedreams</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-11">02/11/18 23:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>there's something weird in the opening - the smell of drying up saliva/spittle on the skin (like when you accidentally sneeze...) which is a bit off-putting. <br />
<br />
but<br />
<br />
then soft floral, not the sweet kind, hard for me to describe. i would say though that the color that i see in my mind when i smell this is exactly the color of the its box - powdery light blue.<br />
<br />
i like this unique scent a lot. i use it sometimes to go to bed.<br />
<br />
try before you buy, but first allow it to bloom on your skin before you make a conclusion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="910630"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=910630#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent910386" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc910386" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="youreyes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10146"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10146.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="youreyes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Rush-686.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.686.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci Rush"title="Gucci Rush"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma910386ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd910386" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/359178">RozaMoisevna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-01-11">01/11/18 21:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Although I haven't smelled an actual bluebell, I know there is a certain type of hyacinths that have the same animalistic note as the perfume. Apart from this note, it is the most realistic hyacinth in the drydown. No wonder it's still a bestseller despite all the harsh reviews.<br />
I imagine a Renaissance lady wearing something that crystal clear and melancholic. Beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="899735"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=899735#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent898802" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
