Classic but not an oldie, interesting but not impressive. probably, "subtle elegance". A real lady's perfume!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="898802"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=898802#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent862793" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc862793" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Annabear"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039259"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1039259.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Annabear" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfum-d-Empire/Eau-Suave-5625.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5625.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Suave"title="Eau Suave"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma862793ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd862793" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1039259">Annabear</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-09-19">09/19/17 20:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An earlier reviewer stated that this may make you feel nauseated at first - spot on. Another reviewer thought it had a stale water in a floral vase vibe...also spot on. I don't like this at all, it smells damp to me, it has a musty, shoe cupboard that needs serious airing feel to the mustiness. A win for one of my daughters who may enjoy it far more than I do.<br />
A disappointment because I have a lot of wonderful Penhaligon fragrances.<br />
Not a safe blind buy, please test this before committing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="862793"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=862793#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent854439" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc854439" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gtabasso"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.132621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gtabasso" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/True-Lust-Rayon-Violet-De-Ses-Yeux-29397.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29397.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="True Lust Rayon Violet De Ses Yeux"title="True Lust Rayon Violet De Ses Yeux"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma854439ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd854439" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/132621">gtabasso</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-08-24">08/24/17 19:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>grassy green and all about the hyacinth</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="854439"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=854439#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent830428" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc830428" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Southern Blonde"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981525"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.981525.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Southern Blonde" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sarah-Jessica-Parker/Lovely-993.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.993.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lovely"title="Lovely"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma830428ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd830428" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/981525">Southern Blonde</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-08">06/08/17 18:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bluebell<br />
<br />
A vintage charmer with a pretty baby blue bottle and the fragrance itself matches up with the cute bottle. This is a "blue" flower in that it smells like wet dewdrops on flower petals after a rain. It's in watercolors and the raindrops are light blue. I thought it would be aquatic in the style of aquatic fragrances like Acqua Di Gioia but it's far from it. This is slightly wet but not a beach seashore type of smell. It's definitely a green floral with distinctive hyacinth, rose, jasmine and lily of the valley. To call it a blue floral would be inaccurate. To me she is a white floral with a blue-purple hyacinth at the top. <br />
<br />
Floral and soft, herbaceous, earthy with cloves, somewhat spiced up with sprinkles of cinnamon and green notes. I'm not familiar with galbanum but if that means it's green all over in the base that's definitely true. There is probably more going on than the notes themselves. This is a nice soapy domesticated fragrance. I don't see myself wearing this out in public. It's a prim and proper English lady who doesn't care for perfume, really, but smells of a good soap. This is meant to stay at home and you wear her when you don't want to smell particularly glamorous or romantic. You wear this when you have visitors at home especially family and small children and you hug them and they get a nice whiff of this lovely toilet water. <br />
<br />
The sillage/longevity is more of the Eau de Toilette kind so it doesn't last as long as a regular parfum. But it's a very conservative and lady-like scent that I like as a breath of fresh air in a world of gourmands and unisex fragrances. This is a feel good old time English floral fragrance. But like others have pointed out, there is something that is not quite upscale about it though by no means cheap either. It's a middle-class home girl. Stay at home mom or grandma. The association one might get with the florals is that it's old lady stuff but it's really quite beautiful and soft and wearable for young women who like floral fragrances. Though not 100 percent the same, I think it bares a similarity to Waterford Lismore. Bluebell is a little wet garden flower after drizzle and rain, giving off a pleasant aroma. I wish it could last longer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="830428"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=830428#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent830199" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc830199" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sukiyakiya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/436210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sukiyakiya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4535.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bluebell"title="Bluebell"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma830199ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd830199" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/436210">sukiyakiya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-06-07">06/07/17 23:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my first niche perfume I ever buy ^^, so I bought 50 ml just in case I don't like it since niche perfume have weird scene too.<br />
I never smelling Bluebell flower, but its kinda powder, i love the smell, but this perfume not long lasting sadly....its only takes 2-3 hours before it gone from my skin, completely.<br />
I want the 100 ml, but the weak longevity made me consider to pick another Penhaligon brand...<br />
maybe its because EDT, perhaps i should try EDP.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="830199"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=830199#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent823992" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc823992" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="VanillaTabbyCat1963"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/92595"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.92595.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="VanillaTabbyCat1963" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma823992ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd823992" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/92595">VanillaTabbyCat1963</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-18">05/18/17 23:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow!! I love love love!! Powder, greens and spice without tons of toothache.<br />
<br />
I'll admit I was afraid to blind-buy because of all the not so positive reviews, but I have a thing for florals that are close to nature. The scent that transports me outdoors will always win my heart. <br />
<br />
 I like to imagine that this is what a Victorian floral would smell like, if I was so lucky to be transported to my lifelong fantasy to the  1800's in the guise of a young and lovely English noble lady! <br />
<br />
I had to laugh when I read about  the "pickle accord"! It's strongly there for a second or three  but dissipates and literally settles into place really quickly.<br />
<br />
English Bluebell is the blue floral that I have been looking for! It is sweet, tart, green and spicy. I get tired of  perfumes that have to present everything through a filter of sweetness.  This is the earthier sister of El's Splendor, which I love in all it's purple and blue glory! The wild sister of the same flower with those wonderful cloves, the living greens and cut out the overwhelming sweetness. <br />
<br />
I discovered that two puffs over L Huere Bleue EDP is just like a Monet garden is to eyes! Glorious!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="823992"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=823992#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent821752" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc821752" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TaleOfTheRose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/968676"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.968676.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="TaleOfTheRose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma821752ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd821752" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/968676">TaleOfTheRose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-05-11">05/11/17 10:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought I was anosmatic to hyacinth in perfume until I got the vintage Bluebell.  It is the real deal.   I tried Anais Anais, Jean Patou Vacances, Smell Bent Florist's Fridge, Guy Laroche Fidji, Vivre Molyneux, YSL Y, Vero Profumo Mito Voile d`Extrait, Chamade, Tears of Eros and Annick Goutal Grand Amour but none of them smell hyacinth the flower to me even though a lot of them are masterpieces.  <br />
My bottle is the box with gold prints instead of white oval label.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="821752"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=821752#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent817333" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc817333" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="missk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7262"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.7262.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="missk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kenzo/Parfum-d-Ete-2002-80.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Parfum d'Ete 2002"title="Parfum d'Ete 2002"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma817333ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd817333" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/7262">missk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-28">04/28/17 04:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bluebell has been on my blind buy radar for some time now. Due to lots of alluring fragrance sales on various websites, I nearly purchased Bluebell twice. I thought it about time that I familiarized myself with this fragrance, so finding a tester on display I quite liberally sprayed Bluebell onto the inside of my wrist.<br />
<br />
I am so very glad I tried this fragrance as it is definitely not for me. Bluebell is a super green floral fragrance, a touch too green for my personal tastes.<br />
<br />
The opening is crisp, green and oddly bitter. I can detect a dominant hyacinth note followed by lily of the valley, jasmine and a spicy hint of clove. I give it five stars for originality, yet I am somewhat disappointed that this fragrance doesn't work for me as I know Bluebell is one of Penhaligon's best sellers.<br />
<br />
Everyone from the Queen to Kate Moss apparently wears Bluebell. It's a fascinating fragrance in that it's bitter, green, spicy, powdery, clean and floral all rolled into one. The scent also packs quite a punch, so if you are the proud owner of a bottle of Bluebell just promise me that you'll go easy on the sprays.<br />
<br />
Perusing the reviews below I see I am not alone in my distaste for this perfume. I strongly advise against blind buys as I now know Bluebell to be quite a polarising scent. I would recommend this fragrance to anyone that loves a classic heady floral and can stomach clove and hyacinth in larges doses.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="817333"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=817333#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent810464" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc810464" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lucia.lawson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013507"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1013507.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lucia.lawson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Caron/La-Selection-Parfum-Sacre-26112.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26112.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Selection Parfum Sacre"title="La Selection Parfum Sacre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma810464ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd810464" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1013507">lucia.lawson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-08">04/08/17 00:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In the UK unless you've been living in a cave and oh alright if you don't care for fragrance, you won't be familiar with their best seller and most renowned fragrance Bluebell. This perfume is a winner in many ways. It is commercially successful, the most successful out of all the Penhaligon fragrances and they are quite large in number and still producing newer fragrances. Bluebell is a green aquatic floral that was traditional of green florals of the 70's, even as Charlie by Revlon was for the 70's in America. It's a beautiful but simple, conservative, classy and most ladylike fragrance. Nevertheless she is not old money nor aristocratic. We are told, or at least I was told, that Princess Diana wore this fragrance. I don't know how to confirm whether that is true or not but it would make sense that she wore this and not Quelques Fleurs on her wedding day to Prince Charles which some people seem to believe. This is a lovely nostalgic scent, fresh, flowery and comforting to a woman who loves flowers. <br />
<br />
Oh how I love this scent. Every time I inhale the aroma it is like catching whiffs of the flowers on a vase in water when the freshness is still there. The opening notes are of hyacinth and perhaps a bit of orange blossom. The citrusy scent is never overpowering allowing the star of the show the hyacinth to shine. If you are familiar with the hyacinth flower speaking in the botanical sense, and the perfumery sense, then you will cherish and love this fragrance. It is a lovely fresh dewy hyacinth, like the hyacinth flower has been kissed by a drizzle of rain. This is a morning dew scent. The freshness of citrus and florals are most invigorating. This is soapy as well and suits you after having taken a shower and you are about to go out and start your day. This is floral toilet water of the highest caliber. I keep it in my bathroom and put it on after a shower. <br />
<br />
A tincture of pink and red rose as a note is in the heart, as well as white jasmine and a very detectable lily of the valley. Now the lily of the valley to me is as prominent as the hyacinth. The lily is green with it's herbaceous aroma, and white floral. So this is very much a traditional old time white floral scent. With that hyacinth and rose, it does feel very floral but it's subtle and not overly fragrant nor too flowery like the aforementioned Quelques Fleurs or Beautiful by Estee Lauder. Neither is it a very musky floral type like Rive Gauche by Yves Saint Laurent. And it certainly isn't a powdery floral like the iris based Paris Yves Saint Laurent. Bluebell is light but not terribly powdery, more soapy and sudsy. This is an intimate, graceful quieter and more relaxed casual floral scent for the morning. <br />
<br />
As the florals fade, the dry down stage reveals notes of spices namely cinnamon, cloves which are earthy and green with a distinctive galbanum. The galbanum note is the glue that holds everything together here. This keeps it in a sort of natural and very green botanical and herbal realm, very much like a wood in England where lily of the valley blooms and where one can smell how green, how wet it is after a rain. Because of this lily of the valley and the rest of the floral notes, this is a spring floral fragrance. It heralds the spring and since spring is just starting it is most appropriate to wear. Bluebell also makes for fine fragrance to scent your home, closets and pillows with.  I can't tell you how much I adore this perfume. It has been with me ever since it's release and has always brought me pleasure and comfort. This is as good as an herbal tea. I wear this only in the mornings in spring and summer. Highly recommended for floral fans.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="810464"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=810464#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent803612" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc803612" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HyacinthBucket"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/208269"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.208269.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HyacinthBucket" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Royal-Crown/Upper-Class-38230.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38230.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Upper Class"title="Upper Class"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma803612ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd803612" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/208269">HyacinthBucket</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-18">03/18/17 21:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lily of the valley. And hyacinth (my favorite). And pickle juice. And cloves. And dill. Perhaps tarragon. And a slight medicinal vibe. And that smell you get when you change the water in a vase of flowers. <br />
<br />
This is not a common scent. It's an acquired taste and not for everyone. I give this a rating of "upper middle class" as opposed to Eau Sans Pareil which rates middle class at best.<br />
<br />
Bluebell is too green for my candlelight suppers but it's perfect for charity committee meetings and afternoon tea with light refreshments.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="803612"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=803612#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent794256" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc794256" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gigi The Fashionista"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/951288"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.951288.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gigi The Fashionista" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragonard/Violette-14299.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14299.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Violette"title="Violette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma794256ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd794256" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/951288">Gigi The Fashionista</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-18">02/18/17 21:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fragrance Review For Bluebell <br />
<br />
Penhaligon<br />
<br />
Top Notes <br />
<br />
Citruses <br />
<br />
Middle Notes<br />
<br />
Hyacinth Rose Jasmine Lily of the Valley Cyclamen <br />
<br />
Base Notes <br />
<br />
Galbanum Cloves Cinnamon <br />
<br />
Mistress Mary Quite Contrary How Does Your Garden Grow? <br />
<br />
With Silver Bells and Cockle Shells And Pretty Maids All In A Row <br />
<br />
- English Nursery Rhyme, 1744 <br />
<br />
I had the opportunity to experience and wear this floral masterpiece at the Penhaligon's fragrance boutique in London. They have all their fragrances with test scent strips for you to try before making up your mind. With countless of fragrances, you're spoilt for choice. I have a few of their colognes and perfumes, most of which are realistic and beautiful florals, but I hadn't experience Bluebell which is their most commercially successful fragrance since it's initial release in 1978.  While most reviewers who have worn this gorgeous floral have likened it to the scent of a bluebell forest in England, or rather, a fresh earthy after the rain type of smell in a floral wood, I was not able to get this when I smelled it. I can see why they say that because it does have an initial aquatic freshness which smells like flowers on water but for me this is something else entirely. This beauty has a Britannic bluebell flower garden aroma that instantly brought to my mind the visual of an English garden, not in a manor house but in a suburb of London. It's a bit of a pretentious perfume, in a cute and funny way. Think Hyacinth Bouquet (or Bucket) from the British TV sitcom KEEPING UP APPEARANCES. She is a middle class average housewife who has a small garden but who, through various ill conceived candlelight suppers, attempts to climb the social ladder and ingratiate herself into the high society and wealthy elite of London! This is a fragrance that can be a chemical aroma nuclear bomb with flowers that though few are garish and super fragrant. Reportedly, it has been a fragrance worn by big Brit names including Princess Diana of Wales, Queen Elizabeth II and Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher. <br />
<br />
The first note I was able to detect, as anyone surely can, is the citrus notes. These are plain ordinary orange blossom citrus type of smells. It's zesty lemon and orange which can match up with the subsequent rose note in the heart, but this was never about soliflore neither as a rose perfume nor a bluebell. Hyacinthoides non-scripta is the genus. That note of bluebell flower is hard to recreate as a note in perfumery but cleverly it comes through in the form of hyacinth which is quite similar to bluebell as it is part of the flowering plant family. This is a rather graphic overwhelmingly green garden scent. The hyacinth is front and center the first flower in the garden but in a row of other flowers. They include lily of the valley which is essentially the same shape of a bell as bluebell but white in color and more green-herbal in it's aroma. There is also a greenish rose scent, white floral jasmine and cyclamen. One can argue that this is a big hyacinth plus white floral scent. The overall mood is not as romantic as say Quelques Fleurs or Estee Lauder Beautiful, but more along the pretty but no nonsense green florals like Cabotine. Still, it's a classic and beautiful as a classically formulated floral. <br />
<br />
In the dry down you experience the smell of cloves, earth, a spice note, cinnamon a little bit of musk and some more greenery. Green notes abound when you pick up on one of my favorite green notes: galbanum. Today this note of galbanum is becoming a rarity which is very saddening because it's one of the more beautiful green notes in florals and chypres. It has a scent that is so amazing that one will mourn it's loss in fragrances when it's completely gone. This green peace floral perfume was quite common in 1970's fragrances. It reminds me of Charlie by Revlon. It also has a bit of Yves Saint Laurent's Rive Gauche. There is no moss but one smells moss because of the green notes like that galbanum and the cloves. It all dries down to a basic musk. This is very pretty and although it has it's detractors, simply put, this is can only get bad when you spray liberally or bathe in it. It's a very lovely fragrance that should not be abused! One spritz in the right place like under my ears or on my chest is enough to make it very pleasant. <br />
<br />
Bluebell is a very fine English garden. It also smells like when you walk into a flower shop but you haven't decided what flowers to put into your bouquet and you smell all the available flowers: the roses, the jasmine, the hyacinth, the lily of the valley. In the end for me the two top floral notes in this perfume are the hyacinth-bluebell and the lily of the valley. Both these scents are incredibly floral and they could have just used these two notes as ingredients and you get the same results. This is a for floral fans only and it has a superb longevity (over 5 hours) and sillage. It receives more compliments than insults and shows you have great taste. It is mature but gorgeous and grown up. It's Victorian and old fashioned. It smells like Eliza Doolittle selling flowers at Convent Garden. It smells of Lewis Carrol's Alice from Alice in Wonderland talking to the flowers. It's a simple and soapy fresh floral to bring pleasure to your home and to wear for the day time as a casual fragrance. Nothing formal about it. Too soapy for evening wear. Day wear flower. Beautiful flower. <br />
<br />
Thank You Penhaligon's! I'll be back!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="794256"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=794256#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent784391" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc784391" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="persefoni"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/201544"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.201544.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="persefoni" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-est-Belle-L-Elixir-95856.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95856.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie est Belle L'Elixir"title="La Vie est Belle L'Elixir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma784391ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd784391" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/201544">persefoni</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-01-22">01/22/17 14:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you go past the first 15 minutes of this perfume (which are truly like a walk at the flower market, vivid green leaves, freshly-cut stems and all!) this is an eccentric perfume that will appeal to few...<br />
<br />
It's green, flowery, heady, doesn't even smell like perfume... and yet it's utterly original! After the much awaited 15' it gets very sweet, juicy-syrupy sweet, and has something that reminds me of my beloved Quel Amour by Goutal! At this stage, the stems and leaves calm down and there's more air to breathe! I obviously prefer this stage to the first, realistic flowery one... To me it has not much in common with Lily of the Valley of the same house..<br />
<br />
Definitely worth trying, if only to experience the intense greenery; however not a safe blind buy by any means!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="784391"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=784391#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent775688" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; PURE Hyacinth.  Strong, pure, real, natural smelling floral/green.   With a rather musty background that's rather enticing... like a fabric softener, but not synthetic smelling.     After a while it does get a bit tiresome though.    It's like i was rubbing a flower bouquet all over me.<br />
<br />
Longevity:  Extreme<br />
Sillage:  Huge</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="755179"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=755179#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent741762" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc741762" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="arielopus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1019217"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="arielopus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Miller-Harris/Tea-Tonique-33765.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33765.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tea Tonique"title="Tea Tonique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma741762ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd741762" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1019217">arielopus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-09-12">09/12/16 14:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my first scent of Penhaligon's and I am very satisfied with my purchasing. It is like the smell of someone finished his/her shower, or even more like the scent of wardrobe or home fragrance. It is really interesting to see people have diverse opinions towards this scent, but for me it is really a lovely and elegant scent! Highly recommend!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="741762"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=741762#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent734929" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc734929" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Eesa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/622349"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.622349.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Eesa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Issey-Miyake/L-Eau-d-Issey-Summer-2014-24063.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.24063.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau d'Issey Summer 2014"title="L'Eau d'Issey Summer 2014"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma734929ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd734929" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/622349">Eesa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-22">08/22/16 03:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unfortunately, I cannot stand this perfume at all.  I'm not sure what is creating such a vile smell.  I do know that I love clove, but in this perfume the clove is out of control.  It's way way way too strong, but I feel like it's still not the root of the evil here.  Is it the hyacinth?  There's something very bitter and wrong here for me.  And this scent is tenacious!  Good if you like it, not so good if you happen to sicken from it.  Definitely smell before buying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="734929"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=734929#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent700764" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc700764" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cinsot"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/13375"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.13375.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cinsot" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma700764ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd700764" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/13375">cinsot</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-28">04/28/16 23:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great review Chri76, inspiring me to reacquaint myself with my long-cherished bottle of Bluebell, reigniting a forgotten fondness for its ancient aroma - thank you!<br />
<br />
Life really is too short not to embrace art daily. <br />
<br />
Bluebell stirs something primitive inside me, it is the aroma of moist soil adhering to naked flesh, vivid images of my carefree youth foraging for mushrooms in rain-forests and tripping in the rain. <br />
<br />
How very unsophisticated of me!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="700764"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=700764#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent700668" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc700668" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chri76"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/179497"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.179497.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chri76" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Santa-Maria-Novella/Melograno-Pomegranate-11480.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11480.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Melograno (Pomegranate)"title="Melograno (Pomegranate)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma700668ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd700668" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/179497">Chri76</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-28">04/28/16 14:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>In the language of the flowers, the bluebell symbolizes constancy, perhaps in reference to Endymion, the Greek hero loved by the goddess Artemis, from whom the scientific name (Endymion non-scriptus) derives. It seems the right meaning for a plant which has the capacity to reappear and spread, year after year, in the woods.<br />
This long lasting fragrance is a perfect representation of the natural flower (the native bluebell). It has a narcotic power as to symbolize the eternal sleep which was donated by Artemis to Endymion in order to preserve his beauty and youth. The floral sweetness is prevented to become cloying by the spicy clove and cinnamon at the base.<br />
Really a masterpiece.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="700668"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=700668#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent696835" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc696835" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TexBex"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/997259"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.997259.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TexBex" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Flower-Drew-Barrymore/Sultry-26863.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.26863.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sultry"title="Sultry"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma696835ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd696835" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/997259">TexBex</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-15">04/15/16 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First impression spray in the air is straight up floral shop! Positive so far.<br />
Purrrfect for a humid, grey spring day, your skin is shining and the air is tense with the promise of (more) rain. The colors are muted and invite you to rest and reflect, breathe and enjoy silent, humble, pure happiness and peace. Not like any other floral or clean scent of mine, subtle enough to be safe for work, present enough to lift my spirits, in short, divine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="696835"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=696835#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent696200" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc696200" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="milazinha"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/860474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.860474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="milazinha" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma696200ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd696200" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/860474">milazinha</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-13">04/13/16 13:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>(If anyone would like to try this, I'm happy to swap decants  for my want list.)<br />
<br />
I sell decants of this elsewhere, and it's one of my bestsellers. Yet, I don't get it. I don't like Bluebell. I *love* the bottle and the color, but the scent is awful to me; too flowery/green and harsh. No sweetness in this. Do people like it because it was Princess Di's favorite? Or because it's flowers on crack? The one good thing I can say is this: this is a UNIQUE scent. You won't find anything similar. Silage and longevity are out of this world, too. If you enter a room wearing this, believe me: you will be noticed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="696200"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=696200#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent693423" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc693423" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ToniTheGirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/997287"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.997287.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ToniTheGirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Melanie-Martinez/Cry-Baby-Perfume-Milk-41799.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41799.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cry Baby Perfume Milk"title="Cry Baby Perfume Milk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma693423ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd693423" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/997287">ToniTheGirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-04">04/04/16 15:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a weird scent.  I bought it online before sampling  because I heard Diana liked it.  Well Diana rest your beautiful soul there is something wrong with your nose.  This perfume has a bunch of different notes to it that belong nowhere near each other and none of them smells like bluebells.  It smells very woody and leathery at first with some kind of vague, very bitter florals and then eventually ends up smelling like diluted cloves.  Every time I spray it I give it another chance but I cannot like this perfume. I'm sorry, but it's bug spray. I've decided to stop buying perfumes before I sample them in a store.  Is this what women's perfume choices were limited to in the past, as I know Penhaligon's has been around for a while, before perfume started to improve?  Whatever, don't like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="693423"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=693423#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent693038" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc693038" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ArianeArborene&#039;sNose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/887304"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.887304.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ArianeArborene&#039;sNose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma693038ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd693038" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/887304">ArianeArborene&#039;sNose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-04-03">04/03/16 10:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have been wearing this scent for years and love it. I feared when I first tried it that my allergies would nix it.  But surprisingly, I have no allergic reaction to it at all. At first, it is spicy and announces itself like walking through the door into a florist's shop -- greens, sharp fresh flower scents.  Then, it relaxes into being a hydrangea of some kind, clear and freshly one central direction to it, just like nature's scent on a hydrangea or hyacinth flower, if you put your nose right up into the flower. It really becomes focused right there, on one central, but complex, flower's scent.  If you want the sense that you are inside a flower shop sitting next to a bin of hydrangeas or hyacinths, that's what this long-lasting scent will do. I never refresh it mid-day.  It carries enough weight on me to last all day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="693038"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=693038#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent669325" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc669325" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HUEbris"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/177739"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="HUEbris" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma669325ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd669325" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/177739">HUEbris</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-21">01/21/16 03:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First It appeared in the air, it's very bitter and dusty, spicy. It may makes you nauseous or headache.<br />
But few minutes after-Yes, It's a realistic hyacinth scent you can smell through the whole perfumes even though the real hyacinth have more green-sticky smell(Just IMHO). <br />
Some Perfumes makes you think, "Is this really perfume?"(too bad or too harsh, mostly) and "Is this suited for me?(because of your image, mostly)". This is one of them to fit both side-in good way. Because It just smells like a flower-a hyacinth. Masterpiece.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="669325"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=669325#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent668991" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc668991" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HeavyBeatsUK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/488635"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.488635.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="HeavyBeatsUK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma668991ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd668991" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);
