It suits her look perfectly!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="668991"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=668991#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent668983" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc668983" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sjam3295"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/233645"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.233645.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sjam3295" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marella-Ferrera/Marella-Ferrera-9261.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9261.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Marella Ferrera"title="Marella Ferrera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma668983ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd668983" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/233645">sjam3295</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-01-20">01/20/16 01:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was wearing Jo Malone's Wild Bluebell yesterday and the contrast with Penhaligon's Bluebell is striking. JNWB is a soft, cool, airy, watery light perfume whereas PB is almost strident in comparison. I smell much more hyacinth in PB, and while the opening is green, which I love, it's much warmer and spicier than JMWB. <br />
In fact, I find the spices, particularly the clove, develop too much for my taste. It is, however, a hot summer day, and this scent may suit cooler weather better. I would say that JMWB is a perfect summer scent for me, while Penhaligon's Bluebell is a Spring or even an Autumn perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="668983"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=668983#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent657968" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc657968" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="magda14012"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18424"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="magda14012" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coco-Noir-15963.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15963.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coco Noir"title="Coco Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma657968ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd657968" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18424">magda14012</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-12-17">12/17/15 06:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It requires an aquired taste to begin to love Bluebell. For starters all I got was the soil, some wet stems of the little flowers still green, not in bloom. It has been quite cold, green floral on my skin. Hyacinth breaks through, followed by some shy lilies. Then it becomes quite linear and spicy.  I have to test it again in the springtime, maybe winter does not suit this gentle gem. Even though I was not loving it, something made me smell my wrists again and again. For sure it is a complicated scent and need more time to unwrap all its beauty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="657968"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=657968#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent652417" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc652417" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sjam3295"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/233645"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.233645.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sjam3295" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marella-Ferrera/Marella-Ferrera-9261.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9261.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Marella Ferrera"title="Marella Ferrera"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma652417ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd652417" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/233645">sjam3295</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-11-29">11/29/15 18:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What an interesting take on a Bluebell perfume. It smells like a bluebell WOOD in very early Spring in England - I can smell the bluebells, but also the foliage, the decaying winter leaves, the rain in the air, the green of the fields around, the freshness and promise of Spring coming. It's floral, herbaceous, fresh - and very evocative. It transports me - I love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="652417"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=652417#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent648435" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc648435" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Steleale"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/833353"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.833353.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Steleale" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma648435ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd648435" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/833353">Steleale</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-11-16">11/16/15 05:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is one of a kind and I absolutely love it. Incredibly evocative of british woods and victorian scenery. Whenever I wear Bluebell I feel myself transported in a ancient british cottage surrounded by green flowery fields and woods in a cloudy autumnal day. Bluebells gives romantic and melhancoly feelings to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="648435"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=648435#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent597099" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/121325">username101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-22">05/22/15 08:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really tried to like this perfume due to it's pretty bottle. I got the Penhaligon's fragrance library and tried it on, hoping I would like, but it just didn't work out. To me it smelled too tomato-y and not floral (which I was expecting) at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="597099"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=597099#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent593939" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc593939" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="magda14012"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18424"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="magda14012" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coco-Noir-15963.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15963.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coco Noir"title="Coco Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma593939ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd593939" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18424">magda14012</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-05-12">05/12/15 03:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely adore fresh lily of the valley. Maybe due to the fact that my birthday is in May and I usually get some. This evokes early springtime, dewy, green, fresh, intoxicating. Does not last very long, but its beauty is worth giving a few additional sprays as the day goes on.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="593939"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=593939#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent576017" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc576017" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="appyfaerie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607805"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607805.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="appyfaerie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma576017ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd576017" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607805">appyfaerie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-11">03/11/15 21:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm not going to lie. To me, this stuff smells like Big Red gum and flowers - mostly the gum. While I love Big Red gum, I certainly do NOT want to smell like it! The description leads one to believe it smells like a refreshing, damp stroll through the woods. Based on that, I would assume it to be something I would utterly love. But I don't.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="576017"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=576017#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent570750" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc570750" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sophie.elizabeth12"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/594154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sophie.elizabeth12" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/Passage-d-Enfer-4572.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4572.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Passage d'Enfer"title="Passage d'Enfer"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma570750ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd570750" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/594154">sophie.elizabeth12</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-02-22">02/22/15 08:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sweet goddess, do I love this.<br />
<br />
Full disclosure - my favourite novel is Dodie Smith's "I Capture The Castle", which features a motif involving bluebells as somewhat metaphorical for the heroine's stilted and hidden sexuality. She is also given a bottle of bluebell-smelling perfume as a Midsummer gift by her sister. In the film, they anachronistically used a bottle of Penhaligon's Bluebell.<br />
<br />
As you can imagine, as a matter of living up to my literary affectations, I had to try it.<br />
<br />
I tested it instore regularly and debated for nearly a year if I loved it or hated it and decided that I loved it and bought myself a bottle.<br />
<br />
The galbanum swung it for me. Chanel 19 EDP is my favourite scent lately and I dig that cruel, cold galbanum scent. Its presence in Bluebell gives interest to an otherwise tame floral.<br />
<br />
The clove also gives it an earthiness and a rottenness that I appreciate. I love the smell of a little bit of decay. (And my favourite scene of "I Capture" takes place in a wood full of bluebells that have just wilted, which adds to my glee).<br />
<br />
It's not for everyone. It's a cold but very flowery floral, and if used too liberally is a headache waiting to happen. The vague decaying foliage note will put people off. It's just a touch on the mad side, too.<br />
<br />
But to me it's bluebell-covered woodland walks on spring evenings, it's ink in diaries and moss on castle walls and it reminds me of a story I will love for my whole life.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="570750"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=570750#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent565744" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc565744" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ginnywho"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/328556"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.328556.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ginnywho" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma565744ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd565744" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/328556">ginnywho</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-02-05">02/05/15 16:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Old vase water from rotting flowers initially comes to mind at first whiff, and that very thought ran through my head when I spritzed this on. After a few moments, I started to smile and wondered "What IS this potion?" I find it so hard to describe but impressions such as cold, formal, old, young, bitter, restrained, stuffy, embalmed, inhibited, fresh, haunting, spring, subdued, proper, and ladylike ran through my head. The putrid old vase water was gone and I was left stumped for words, which for me is a rarity if not miraculous. Left me shaking my head, but still smiling. Final impression: contradictory. Maybe that's why I like it, because it dances to its own tune. Tut tut well done, old chap!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="565744"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=565744#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent556715" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc556715" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ruffienne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821453"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.821453.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ruffienne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma556715ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd556715" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/821453">Ruffienne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-01-09">01/09/15 00:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh out of the bottle Bluebell has a very true fresh scent of spanish bluebells, complete with the incredibly distinctive smell of crushed bluebell stems and woodland humus.<br />
<br />
I was charmed by this olefactory nostalgia, but the charm rapidly faded as the drydown developed.  <br />
<br />
The drydown takes the crushed green stems of bluebells and distorts it into something intellectually interesting but nasally repulsive.  The odour is bitter and green, and quite repellent (to me), with little in the way of other notes to lighten the experience.<br />
<br />
This is one of the few perfumes I have had to scrub in self-defense, as it is strong and has a longevity that I tested to my limits (around four hours) rather than the limits of the perfume, before scrubbing it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="556715"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=556715#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent540642" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc540642" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ivoiresearch"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/115919"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.115919.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ivoiresearch" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/Mure-et-Musc-1049.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1049.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mure et Musc"title="Mure et Musc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma540642ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd540642" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/115919">ivoiresearch</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-11-13">11/13/14 12:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This isn't a review, just something that might be of interest - apparently it's one of Kate Moss's favourite scents - and and it was the favourite scent of ... Margaret Thatcher.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="540642"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=540642#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent526113" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc526113" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ankali"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/823986"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.823986.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ankali" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nobile-1942/Patchouli-Nobile-10776.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10776.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Patchouli Nobile"title="Patchouli Nobile"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma526113ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd526113" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/823986">ankali</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-25">09/25/14 09:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is awful for the first 10 minutes (my husband's first association was turpentine), but once past that blast it becomes something very unique and lovely on me: green, spicy, and lightly floral, like a wet, wooded area just near the flower beds in a palace garden. Consider me a new acolyte in the cult of Bluebell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="526113"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=526113#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent526092" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc526092" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="username101"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/121325"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.121325.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="username101" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Erbario-Toscano/Violetta-Nobile-39853.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39853.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Violetta Nobile"title="Violetta Nobile"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma526092ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd526092" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/121325">username101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-25">09/25/14 08:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very pretty bottle but disappointing smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="526092"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=526092#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent525663" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc525663" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="juju-qtr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/843095"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.843095.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="juju-qtr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma525663ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd525663" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/843095">juju-qtr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-24">09/24/14 00:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>it smells like bubblegum!<br />
waste of money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="525663"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=525663#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent525596" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc525596" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hippiechick13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/602954"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.602954.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hippiechick13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma525596ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd525596" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/602954">hippiechick13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-23">09/23/14 18:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a bold, wet-green scent.  Of greenhouses and fresh rain. It isn't for everyone, isn't delicate in the way one expects it too - though once it dries a little, it evens out.  At first, it is a little surprising, but it finds its own on the skin in time, not changing too much, but coming across as less potent.<br />
<br />
If you like full, strong perfumes that recall the wilderness, the green and grey, windswept days, this could be your bottle.  The drama of the Irish or Scottish craggy and peaty coastlines.  The tang of that icy salty air in the nose. Definitely what I would place in the 'cooler' perfumes category, for the moisture and greyness and rain-like energy to it.  Strangely compelling.<br />
<br />
<br />
There is a romanticism and enchanting quality to Bluebell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="525596"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=525596#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent508930" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc508930" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="becuille"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/768337"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.768337.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="becuille" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vero-Profumo/Kiki-Eau-de-Parfum-10117.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10117.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kiki Eau de Parfum"title="Kiki Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma508930ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd508930" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/768337">becuille</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-29">07/29/14 23:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like many other reviewers, I don't know whether to love or hate this. Is it a ferocious, lush green floral or is it a bitter, boorish mess? I changed my mind on that every 15 minutes or so. <br />
<br />
The hyacinth is beautiful, all earthy and green. But the lily of the valley is a bit of a problem for me. I think it may be what makes me veer from love to hate with this fragrance at times. There's something very synthetic about it. Of course, synthetics can be a great addition to a perfume, but I'd expect a house like Penhaligon's to use a high quality lily of the valley. Perhaps they did, but something about the way it smells here reminds me of making "perfumes" in a bowl when I was a little kid. The rose it fairly potent throughout and again, I'm torn with what to make of it. On the one hand, it's a really beautiful rose scent. On the other, I don't quite feel it belongs here. <br />
<br />
The hint of spice is subtle and intriguing. I can't help but want to strip this one right back to just the hyacinth and the spice to see what would happen then. <br />
<br />
The blending isn't as masterful here as I'm used to from this house. <br />
<br />
Just as I write this off as an icky mess, I catch a whiff of delicious, spicy earth and fall in love with it. Then I change my mind again! <br />
<br />
I actually think if I smelled this on someone else I'd really like it and be impressed they'd tackled such a difficult perfume. I just can't decide at all if I want to wear it on myself. It manages to be both beautiful, fascinating and a scrubber all at the same time. <br />
<br />
It's a strange one!<br />
<br />
The sillage is fairly strong (although not disturb a whole room strong) and the longevity is insane. Showering didn't even remove this. <br />
<br />
I think this might be for days when you need to project your best "I'm brave and I don't give a damn" image.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="508930"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=508930#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent490003" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc490003" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pi^2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/788602"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.788602.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pi^2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/Eau-de-Memo-44229.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44229.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau de Memo"title="Eau de Memo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma490003ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd490003" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/788602">pi^2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-28">05/28/14 01:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A bad blind-buy. I used to have hyacinths flowering all over my house and I wanted something that smells like them. I could not get this one to test it before buying so I ordered it online and what a disappointment! It's heavy, cold, unpleasant, gives me a headache (which I'm not prone to), and as one of the reviewer said, simply off-putting. But it's an interesting smell, I must say.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="490003"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=490003#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent489449" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc489449" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gomt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/131621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.131621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="gomt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma489449ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd489449" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/131621">gomt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-26">05/26/14 10:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely can understand why this one can be both loved and hated at once. I've tried it several times, and still haven't made my mind. <br />
<br />
It starts off terribly, it smells exactly like the water left in your vase after the flowers have wilted. But after a quarter or a little longer, it turns more pleasant. But not easy to wear, mind you. <br />
<br />
It's heavy, wet, dirty and dark. It's a mixture of hyacinth, dew and wet grass on me. I can't really pick particular notes, though - just the general fragrant image. <br />
<br />
Bluebell is not a safe everyday perfume, I believe it can't be comfortably worn in the office - it cannot be contained within four walls. It's the smell of freedom and wildness, with all their darker side. <br />
<br />
I can totally imagine HBO Girls' character Jessa Johansson wearing it. Wild, dark, puzzling thing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="489449"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=489449#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent477148" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc477148" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tgb79905"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/348646"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="tgb79905" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma477148ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd477148" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/348646">tgb79905</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-04-17">04/17/14 14:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love it and hate it.  Yes, it smells like toilet cleaner for several minutes in the beginning.  Yes there is a terrible, sharp, chemical lily-of-the-valley.  But after those fade away there is a very heady, crazy town, wet floral.  Wet wet wet, like April in a swampy woods, roots are rotting, logs are water soaked, and Lady Chatterley is running naked through the trees in the rain.  It's fabulously weird.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="477148"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=477148#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent468934" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc468934" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Grottola"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47939"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.47939.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Grottola" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma468934ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd468934" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47939">Grottola</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-03-22">03/22/14 13:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bluebell is an absolutely lovely floral built around gorgeous white flowers, the particular combo being lily of the valley and hyacinth, both which combine along with the galbanum and citrus to bring a bit of sweet "fizziness" to the whole thing.  Doesn't smell old or dirty, it's very accessible, very high quality, and just enjoyable all around.  INCREDIBLE longevity - it lasts over twenty hours on me, even with a shower.  I'm sure I'll probably get a bottle of Bluebell at some point, because, even if it is a feminine, I'm a sucker for springtime white florals.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="468934"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=468934#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent448349" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc448349" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Melvinmilk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/450560"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.450560.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Melvinmilk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/En-Passant-2793.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2793.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="En Passant"title="En Passant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma448349ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd448349" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/450560">Melvinmilk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-20">01/20/14 17:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>She comes from the 7th dimension <br />
She is his exquisite capture, his soul possession. <br />
She enchants him with out speaking <br />
She keeps his darkest secrets in a charm around her neck. <br />
<br />
He is a nomad, a seeker looking for his heart <br />
He is hideously handsome and deeply flawed <br />
He has eyes that are so dark, that only She can light his way <br />
He is the Seraphim's keeper <br />
<br />
She loves him in a place far beyond his understanding <br />
She lights his path and  innocently guides him towards her <br />
She is the one who stole his heart, he is coming to take it back. <br />
<br />
He devoured her beauty.<br />
He wants her madly...constantly.<br />
He  possessed her mind her body<br />
He darkened her soul <br />
He takes her until she is no more <br />
<br />
He will forever be a man lost in deranged desire<br />
She will forever haunt his every moment, <br />
He will take his last breath in total darkness thinking only of her light.<br />
<br />
This mystical fragrance is like an old Scottish fairy tale. It innocently draws you in and leads you into a place that will forever change you.....some for better, some for worse. This is the mystery behind Bluebell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="448349"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=448349#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent445544" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/409244">brt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-12">01/12/14 09:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I tried this for the first time this morning and it's the first Penhaligon's I've ever tried. It been on for more than an hour and honestly, all I get is the scent of dandelion! Reminds me of the dandelion necklaces we used to weave as kids. Not my cup of tea but I will admit the scent seems very pure and straightforward, very linear. I certainly wouldn't pay the asking price for this one. I have better hopes for the other Penhaligon I have a sample of - Ellenisia. We shall see what that one brings when I try it later on.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="445544"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=445544#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent442887" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc442887" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EnglishCountryGarden"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/13463"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.13463.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="EnglishCountryGarden" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Coco-Mademoiselle-611.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.611.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Coco Mademoiselle"title="Coco Mademoiselle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma442887ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd442887" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/13463">EnglishCountryGarden</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-05">01/05/14 10:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Simply the finest, greenest, freshest bowl of forced hyacinths to bloom at Christmas. The difference between this cologne and a bowl of hyacinths, is, unlike the hyacinths, which get top heavy, the fragrance won't topple under it's own weight and start smelling of mushrooms.  Penhaligons produced a soliflore of pure genius with this one.  Blue outdoor hyacinths have the strongest perfume, and this captures it, right there, when the flower first displays it's sharp, green,  violently joyful bloom.  Marvellous.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="442887"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=442887#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent433620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
