padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/81400">lassmichdich</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-25">11/25/13 15:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i wear this quite elegantly...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="429807"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=429807#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent396718" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc396718" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="doowee.teja"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/237292"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.237292.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="doowee.teja" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Orange-Blossom-2279.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2279.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orange Blossom"title="Orange Blossom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma396718ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd396718" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/237292">doowee.teja</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-08-16">08/16/13 07:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Elegant, peaceful and sophisticated. Those are the feeling i get, when i use this bluebells.<br />
This is my first London perfume, i think is unique and lovely!<br />
Do you know how it feels when you are staying in the garden that filled with flower that blooms along with a morning dew!<br />
I do understand some people find this a little offensive, becuase it gives the vibe of fresh mowing lawns. I find it its a little too much of you have a headache.<br />
Personally I think this is too strong for summer, but great on fall and winter season, especially for evening time!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="396718"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=396718#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent389937" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc389937" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sofiebgoode"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410671"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.410671.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sofiebgoode" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Donna-Karan/DKNY-Be-Delicious-498.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.498.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="DKNY Be Delicious"title="DKNY Be Delicious"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma389937ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd389937" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/410671">sofiebgoode</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-26">07/26/13 04:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Does anyone else find this unexpectedly great for hot summer days? On warm skin and near water (as in pool, lake, ocean) it turns almost aquatic and very fresh. The "blue" notes really come out and the bitterness is toned down. I keep buying fragrances marketed as summer scents, but I keep coming back to Bluebell for the perfect outdoorsy summer mood.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="389937"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=389937#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent385638" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc385638" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lovingthealien"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/161623"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.161623.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lovingthealien" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Shalimar-Eau-de-Parfum-53.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Shalimar Eau de Parfum"title="Shalimar Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma385638ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd385638" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/161623">lovingthealien</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-12">07/12/13 00:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Although I had been looking for a hyacinth soliflore for a long time, I had always avoided this one due to the many terrible reviews. As luck would have it, a chance meeting with a new fragrance-loving friend ended up scoring me a sample of this.<br />
<br />
I love it.<br />
<br />
This is the hyacinth I have been waiting for. What is perhaps repellant to others is what makes me adore it so much. The sweet, saliva-like quality of the flower is rendered quite well. It is very heady and indolic. The only annoying thing is the cheap muguet in the opening, but it clears up after a short while. It captures the overbearing and almost disconcerting nature of hyacinth brilliantly. I bought a full bottle right away.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="385638"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=385638#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent380905" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc380905" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Haptica"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/556082"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.556082.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Haptica" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Vilhelm-Parfumerie/Moon-Carnival-51930.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51930.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Moon Carnival"title="Moon Carnival"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma380905ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd380905" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/556082">Haptica</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-26">06/26/13 15:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a "library" of scents on line, this one included. At first application it smells acid, high-pitched, stinky and sweet, like ketotic saliva. After a weird few minutes the sweet smell goes away and what is left is smoky, green and peppery. Wearing it I feel like I've just wandered into a Tanzanian spice bazaar. Adventurous, intoxicating, understated, precious.   <br />
<br />
It used to be all-chypres all the time, but in the past few years I've started seeing the attraction of those lighter 1970's perfumes: fresh, light, ephemeral. This eau has very little staying power like one of my other favorites: Le de Givency.  But staying power or not, this is a perfume for someone who whispers to make herself heard. <br />
<br />
One odd thing, it smells a bit "blue" to me. Perhaps that's the cyclamen ... ?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="380905"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=380905#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent363419" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc363419" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pbluberry"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/298733"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.298733.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pbluberry" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma363419ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd363419" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/298733">pbluberry</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-05-05">05/05/13 22:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first spray, it's really terrible. It almost has a grandma's old coat or tapistry smell. It's a little hard to describe, almost a musty incense smell to me with a hint of cocoa. It's a little tricky this is to wear. I am kind of on the fence about it. I don't hate it but I don't know if I like it that much, but it's wearable to me. When they say warm spicy, they really meant it. After a few minutes, it fades into something interesting. Alot of people say dirt, I can relate to that. The dry down is florale but a very dry florale, alot of hyacinth which I found to be too much in this. Hyacinth is aways so dominating in a lot of fregrances to me.<br />
<br />
I want to thank Vie Cafe for her generosity. Thanks!! :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="363419"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=363419#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent358904" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc358904" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GuanYin2013"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/478531"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.478531.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GuanYin2013" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Japon-Noir-1851.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1851.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Japon Noir"title="Japon Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma358904ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd358904" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/478531">GuanYin2013</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-04-22">04/22/13 09:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me this perfume has no complexity. It has only one note. It smells like dead hyacinths - sweet, sickly, decay. It is almost inexpressibly vile. It is so bad, I could not even use it the way I do other perfumes I dislike e.g. as a room freshener, linen spray. I poured it down the bathroom sink and had to run the taps to flush it away. Nasty beyond nasty. I seem to react this way to any perfume with an iris, lily, lily of the valley, bluebell or hyacinth note. <br />
<br />
I have tried about ten Penhaligon's fragrances and I find them all underwhelming or worse. The fragrances are either utterly disgusting (e.g. Bluebell, Lily of the Valley) or slight, watery, vague, uninteresting (Artemisia, Lily and Spice, Malabah, Endymion, Quercus). The only Penhaligon's fragrance I could say I like is Blenheim Bouquet but it is so weak and has such a short, simple development that it feels like a waste of time and money and I usually wear it layered to allow it to be carried by better constructed fragrances. <br />
<br />
Verdict: a big thumb down for Penhaligon's in general and absolute revulsion for Bluebell in particular.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="358904"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=358904#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent356068" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc356068" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="happyanna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/298770"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="happyanna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma356068ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd356068" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/298770">happyanna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-04-13">04/13/13 16:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>PLEASE READ THIS<br />
I have tried every obscure perfume going, this one is the sit on the fence type. It is a rare smell, no perfume has come close to how this smells and it is unique. However I like this smell on a card and on myself but can see how it is over whelming. If you don't do floral don't buy. It does smell of earth, a little bit dirty! But it is strong in floral too. I like it for the dirty bit and find that once the floral has exploded and settled I can deal with it. I am normally a fresh or amber girl and this is in the middle. I think the true test is how others react, definitely different. Trust me I have tried all sorts!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="356068"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=356068#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent342557" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc342557" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wallywinthrop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/329711"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.329711.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="wallywinthrop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Illuminum/White-Gardenia-Petals-11806.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11806.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Gardenia Petals"title="White Gardenia Petals"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma342557ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd342557" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/329711">wallywinthrop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-03-05">03/05/13 08:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is lovely, it is basically transplanted hyacinth in a bottle, which is a polarising scent and one that I love in nature but wouldn't always if it was just bottled for ambient use.  I make exception for this one as it is clean and fresh, it is not a sweet floral by any means but smells very much like springtime and the English bluebells I love.  It has a delicate rose note in the drydown that compliments warm skin well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="342557"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=342557#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent342015" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc342015" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tsofa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/5315"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.5315.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tsofa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Korres/Aegean-Bronze-72695.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72695.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aegean Bronze"title="Aegean Bronze"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma342015ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd342015" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/5315">tsofa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-03-03">03/03/13 15:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I dont get any of the British bluebell woods vibes from this perfume, although I would love to.<br />
<br />
My husband bought it from a Penhaligons store, in London. He first called me, how nice of him, as they had offers both on Malabah and Bluebell. Although I had a sample of Malabah that I enjoyed, I decided to try Bluebell.<br />
<br />
If it was only for the floral part of the scent, I would most probably like it, but to me this looks more like a floral spicy herby green mesh. I dont get any of the citruses notes on my skin, just pure spice notes, with some hints of green if this makes any sense. I also dont like the base notes, my body chemistry despises them so much, that every time I try to convince myself that I like Bluebell, I burn my nostrils!<br />
<br />
I must admit, although, this perfumes longevity is amazing for an Eau de Toilette. But to me, it still stays a disappointment</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="342015"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=342015#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent329651" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc329651" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cecfor"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/210955"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.210955.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cecfor" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stephane-Humbert-Lucas-777/Wish-Come-True-44263.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44263.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wish Come True"title="Wish Come True"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma329651ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd329651" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/210955">cecfor</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-01-28">01/28/13 01:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like both hyacinth and Lily-of-the-Valley. Fond of galbanum too. So I thought I might like this one. However there can be too much of a thing even if you like it and that was the case here. Very much hyacinth and Lily-of-the-Valley first and also bitter at this point. Not pleasant. Husband got an itchy throat so I had to wash it off first time. Today he is not at home so I try it again. When that first not so pleasant phase is gone the rose is the most evident on my skin and it is softer. A small hint of cinnamon is there too. It is all right at this point I think if you like roses.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="329651"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=329651#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent322540" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc322540" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="anushya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/169914"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.169914.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="anushya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Figuier-Eden-14878.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14878.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Figuier Eden"title="Figuier Eden"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma322540ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd322540" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/169914">anushya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-01-07">01/07/13 05:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hi. I'm a newbie reviewer but I felt so strongly about this perfume, I had to let it out. This smells terrible on me!! I wanted so-sO-SO hard to like this but it just broke my heart. It smells vile on me. Like burnt rubber, and BURNT RUBBER. I had to get if off me but it sticks to you like crazy glue. I understand a lot people saying that you need to let it evolve on your skin but what if it's killing you?? I washed it off and rubbed in a big dollop of ellenisia lotion. Now that is totally up my street. I just so wanted to love BLUEBELL. Just not meant to be I guess. Maybe I'll try it again in a different weather, different age. Who knows the relationship might rekindle again. But for now it was just a 2 minute winter fling that ended very very badly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="322540"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=322540#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent310090" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc310090" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lakuota"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/169565"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.169565.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lakuota" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Banana-Republic/17-Oud-Mosaic-45031.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45031.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="17 Oud Mosaic"title="17 Oud Mosaic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma310090ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd310090" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/169565">lakuota</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-12-04">12/04/12 05:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My, oh my... This one doesn't work out for me by any means. I have a decant, which I got in summer. I disliked it in summer, I disliked it in autumn, I dislike it in winter. Only from personal interest i'm keeping in until spring - maybe suddenly it will become more wearable. My another idea is to layer this perfume with some heavy smoky incense scent to elicit something similar to LAP Passage d'Enfer. I see no other way to make it work, because what i feel now is a smell of cheap and disgusting air freshener. The only people I imagine could be wearing this are either shepherd girl from a fairytale or sentimental older lady, who didn't have the chance to try any other decent perfume in her youth and stuck to this one. <br />
<br />
And it could have been a lovely perfume with hints of fresh cut grass at the beginning, subtle pink rose in heart notes and rich galbanum in drydown... Why did they have to kill it all with that atomic mix of rotten hyacinths and lily-of-the-valleys?? You can't explore dynamics of the scent, because there is no one - everything is overshadowed with those florals and scent seems very linear. Do you mind sniffing that synthetic smell on your writ all day (yes, it's very long lasting)? I hope you do.<br />
<br />
I expected English bluebell meadow, but the reality is far from this fantasy. Hyacinths and lilies smelled way better in my grandma's garden. Exquisite bottle, though. And thanks for reminding of the "I Capture The Castle".</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="310090"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=310090#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent302298" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc302298" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="9-na"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/267777"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="9-na" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/The-Afternoon-of-a-Faun-15948.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15948.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Afternoon of a Faun"title="The Afternoon of a Faun"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma302298ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd302298" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/267777">9-na</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-11-09">11/09/12 20:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The ironblooded one. Well, this scent doesn't smell of iron or blood to me. But the impression is here, and is not about to leave me, it lasts, boy, it does. As for the smelling part, it's my Granny's garden lily-of-the-valley scent, just like I remember, I pick a bunch of flowers and put my nose into the bunch, touching it, drinking its smell, getting almost drunk with the smell, and the feeling of leaves on my skin is here too, yes. And there is something metallish in the very smell of the flowers, like it lives in there, runs through the flowers the way blood does when we talk about people. I like the scent. It is nice... and it has a spine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="302298"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=302298#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent300313" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc300313" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nearfantastica"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/48043"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.48043.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nearfantastica" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Si-18453.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18453.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Si"title="Si"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma300313ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd300313" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/48043">nearfantastica</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-11-03">11/03/12 20:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My Mum bought this for herself because she is a devout follower of the Royals, Lady Di in particular and she thought it would be nice to own and wear a fragrance the "Peoples Princess" once wore. However, when she opened the box and sprayed it on herself, she took one whiff and was absolutely REVOLTED!! She didn't say why or what it was she did not like but she despised it. So, she gave it to me, thinking I would swap it for something else. I am usually a lover of Orientals and sweet perfumes and the occasional floral so I really was not expecting to like this, nevermind LOVE it. But, to my surprise, after about five minutes on my skin I am just in love with this fragrance. The only other florals I truly adore are the original Yves Rocher "Pivoine" and the original "Chloe"...add this gem and that rounds out my top three favorite florals. Now seeing it is winter, I won't be wearing this out of the house until snow melt come April, but if I know I am not going anywhere and I will be in the house, I will surround myself in the gorgeous blue garden...if I am lucky enough to spend Christmas on my beloved Vancouver Island, this perfume will be attached to my hip. It is utterly moody, beautifully composed and entirely feminine..you can be sure no one else will smell like you whilst adorned in this cloak of beauty...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="300313"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=300313#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent288363" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc288363" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MrsLetterO"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/218503"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.218503.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MrsLetterO" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Alexander-McQueen/My-Queen-1294.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1294.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="My Queen"title="My Queen"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma288363ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd288363" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/218503">MrsLetterO</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-09-25">09/25/12 13:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ahh Bluebell.. loved or hated in these reviews. Full of notes I don't like and yet I can't quite stop smelling my wrist. The last time I had this was with L'Ombre dans L'Eau.. tomato plant, rose, cassis.. blast of green and then sweet sweet. This is a similar experience. It is more than the sum of it's parts. It's spicy yet cold. Earthy yet candied. It is strange but I keep coming back to it. Where I live we have many bluebell woods. People crash their cars on the bends in the road as they stare into the forest. One bluebell is pretty, but millions of bluebells carpet the ground, hiding under the trees, spreading out in all directions. Silly but it feels like you've found magic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="288363"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=288363#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent263029" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc263029" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kxnaiades"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/190841"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.190841.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kxnaiades" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Journey-Woman-25252.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25252.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Journey Woman"title="Journey Woman"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma263029ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd263029" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/190841">kxnaiades</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-06-26">06/26/12 21:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i'm sorry. i tried so hard to love this. i wanted so much to love this especially after that movie " i capture the castle". but no. i love penhaligon's but this is revolting to me. i don't smell any bluebells... well none that are alive at any rate. it just smells ? rotten. i apologise to all who love this but i won't blind buy a full bottle to those who haven't tried it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="263029"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=263029#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent263027" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc263027" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karlovonamesti"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.19849.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karlovonamesti" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma263027ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd263027" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849">karlovonamesti</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-06-26">06/26/12 21:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I agree with those reviewers who find Bluebell to be an abomination, but my take might be a bit less knee-jerk. Here's the thing about Bluebell: it is what it is. Chemical hyacinth, blaringly strong, right up front, with piercing lilac and galbanum flanking it. Then, an earthier accord of clove and cinnamon, which actually breathes a welcome airiness (ironically) into the composition. Penhaligon's was successful in creating a scent that mimicked damp earth with a faint floral haze hovering over it. For about fifteen minutes there, Bluebell has me thinking that this brand actually made a beautiful perfume. Then, sadly, the whole thing goes flat. Hyacinth, lilac, cinnamon, clove, wet earth, dewey flowers, all deflate like an understaffed Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade float. In the end, Bluebell smells like a toilet cleaner.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="263027"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=263027#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent260750" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc260750" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="abigailandgeorge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/236520"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.236520.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="abigailandgeorge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma260750ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd260750" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/236520">abigailandgeorge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-06-18">06/18/12 11:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A truly beautiful scent; it evokes memories of a time gone by, from the heady aroma of fresh cut hyacinths, to the quaint Victorian style bottle and packaging. A timeless perfume; a gift to treat oneself.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="260750"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=260750#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent258285" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc246914" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Belladonna_dea"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.47213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Belladonna_dea" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boucheron/Boucheron-133.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.133.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boucheron"title="Boucheron"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma246914ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd246914" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47213">Belladonna_dea</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-04-30">04/30/12 11:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The minute I applied it I was instantly taken back to walking outside on our farm as a young girl in the bitterweeds.  It wasn't perfumey outside, it was literally like walking outside. I am stumped at how they captured a picture in my mind, in a bottle. Impressive.  Then the perfume began to take on a soapy quality on my skin. After that it quickly went away. Not something I would wear, but it's interesting and I definitely enjoyed the experience.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="246914"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=246914#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent219367" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc219367" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stacia79"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/151903"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.151903.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stacia79" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma219367ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd219367" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/151903">stacia79</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2012-01-27">01/27/12 21:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There is something so evocative in this. My childhood, walks in the woods, talking with God. This seems like it should be worn by a young maiden from another era, it has a fairytale quality to it. I also enjoy the I Capture The Castle reference this perfume has. Ultimately it felt too green for me, but it is haunting and rather long lasting. This would be fantastic on a girl with pale blonde hair and porcelain complexion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="219367"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=219367#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent202110" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36097">Printeza7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-11-29">11/29/11 14:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely adore this perfume. At first I really did not like it, but I have tried it again and again and discovered that the smell is simply just fresh cut hyacinths!When I wear it I feel like I just cut some bluebells from the forest and the fragrance of the green leaves and the flowers is penetrating my skin making this wonderful spring scent.Then the middle notes make their entry settling the fragrance to a softer, more serious smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="202110"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=202110#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent201709" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
