Captures the scent of walking through the bluebell woods.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="201709"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=201709#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent193646" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc193646" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fwwm"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/108875"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.108875.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fwwm" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Clean/Cotton-T-Shirt-12038.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12038.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cotton T-Shirt"title="Cotton T-Shirt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma193646ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd193646" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/108875">fwwm</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-10-30">10/30/11 07:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really wanted to love Bluebell by Penhaligon`s, but I dont... I am sorry, but it is way to sharp and spicy. Then strong tones of roses. I see all the praise this scent gets here - so it might be my skin in the summer time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="193646"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=193646#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent191658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc191658" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cryptic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/120917"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.120917.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cryptic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Prada/Infusion-d-Iris-1795.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1795.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Infusion d'Iris"title="Infusion d'Iris"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma191658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd191658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/120917">cryptic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-10-22">10/22/11 19:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bluebell has a cult following for a reason.  It may not be alluring or sensual, but it is certainly a romantic fragrance. It conjures up "I Capture the Castle," blustery Spring days and the beautiful English landscape.<br />
<br />
I think one of the reasons why Bluebell gets panned is the vast difference between expectations and reality.  Judging from the name and the packaging, you would be more than justified in expecting Bluebell to be a delicate English floral.  In actuality, Bluebell is a striking blend of assertive notes:  chilly green galbanum, sharp clove and a very vivid hyacinth.  Surprise!<br />
<br />
I'll admit that the gorgeous packaging is part of my attraction to the Penhaligon's line.  I'm deeply grateful for perfume that doesn't remind me of a cleaning product or an energy drink by virtue of the plasticky bottle and the lurid coloring.  If saying so makes me superficial, I guess I can live with that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="191658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=191658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent171351" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc171351" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lara0905"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47571"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.47571.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lara0905" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Baruti/Perverso-54651.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54651.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Perverso"title="Perverso"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma171351ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd171351" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47571">lara0905</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-08-08">08/08/11 05:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Penhaligon's Bluebell is an interesting fragrance. The opening is very green.I don't get lemons or any citrus note. Fresh cutted grass with some hyacinth. After a few minutes is settles down to a  little powdery- musky -hiachynt-lily of the valley with some cinnamon undertone. The drydown is very close to skin.<br />
<br />
I think this frag is could be a nice daytime scent if it's works well with the skin chemistry.Actually I really like it, perfect for spring days.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="171351"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=171351#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent171311" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc171311" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alfarom"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.37900.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alfarom" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Gris-Clair-593.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.593.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gris Clair"title="Gris Clair"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma171311ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd171311" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37900">alfarom</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-08-08">08/08/11 01:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ok, let's stop for once playng the good boys and girls game.<br />
<br />
Sometimes I forget how much a perfume can be ugly and annoying. Anytime it happens I reach for Bluebell as a reminder. Horrifying synthetic floral at its worst. Simply abominable.<br />
<br />
Rating: 2/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="171311"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=171311#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent156600" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc156600" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sgiammic"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/51040"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.51040.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sgiammic" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma156600ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd156600" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/51040">sgiammic</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-06-13">06/13/11 13:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I liked this perfume, but was disappointed that I didn't love it.  It was very linear for me: first sharp, wet and earthy, then cloves, then sweet sweet rose.  None of it bothered me, and I enjoyed the mix of earth, spice and sweet flowers.  Ultimately, the rose was just too sweet for me; the floral element has a real saccharine quality, so sweet it's synthetic.  <br />
<br />
I notice that different people experience the notes with varying strength. One of my sisters smelled straight cloves, and the other smelled wet earth and forest -- she loved it.  I suggest giving this one a try!  Not for me, but I can definitely respect people's love for it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="156600"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=156600#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent155484" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Too bad, because I had high hopes. Too green, too hyacinth. And I have to agree with Tessture, too much like frsh garden dirt!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="155484"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=155484#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent151886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc151886" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maximus1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/62568"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="maximus1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Miss-Dior-Cherie-213.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.213.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Miss Dior Cherie"title="Miss Dior Cherie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma151886ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd151886" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/62568">maximus1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-05-28">05/28/11 08:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Princess Diana wore Tearose on her wedding day, according to the mother of one of the flowergirls. She wore it also and had a conversation with Diana about how they wore the same fragrance. She also wore Miss Dior for a very long time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="151886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=151886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent150076" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc150076" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahlindabeth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/60013"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahlindabeth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma150076ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd150076" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); Quite a nice few minutes, but very expensive.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="150076"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=150076#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent141951" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc141951" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Siv7Stars"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.47621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Siv7Stars" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Fire-At-Will-70289.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70289.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fire At Will"title="Fire At Will"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma141951ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd141951" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47621">Siv7Stars</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-04-23">04/23/11 17:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really wanted to like this when I tested it when I went to London. I love the Alice in Wonderland style bottle (did Tenniel influence the designer?) and I love the smell of bluebell woods. However this doesn't smell like them, nor indeed, of any of the notes puported to be in it. Nailvarnish remover and wee and something stale. Did not appear to drydown into anything nice, just disappeared thank god. Unfathomable that anyone would buy this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="141951"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=141951#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent116586" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc116586" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cereza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27358"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27358.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cereza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Farmacia-SS-Annunziata/Vaniglia-del-Madagascar-9584.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9584.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vaniglia del Madagascar"title="Vaniglia del Madagascar"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma116586ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd116586" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27358">Cereza</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-12-20">12/20/10 08:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was hoping for lovely floral green, but what did I get in return? Something terrible. Sharp, full of clove and spices, the clove is so strong that I can't even feel any flowers. MUST SCRUB OFF NOW!<br />
<br />
P.S. On the other hand - don't want anyone come near you? Wear this. This will scare off not only vampires (clove!), but every other human being. Or being. My cats are horrified.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="116586"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=116586#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent112950" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc112950" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma112950ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd112950" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-11-27">11/27/10 23:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought the bottle because it was so pretty, thinking the scent would be light and floral.  I could hardly believe my nose when I sprayed it on my wrist.  I wanted to return it but couldn't.  It is extremely strong and smells purely like rose, black pepper, cinnamon, and sandalwood.  Sounds revolting, no?  Totally unexpected after looking at those delicate little bluebells on the bottle.  I can't believe that any classy English lady would wear it, except for maybe the Queen.  There is nothing quintessential English about it.  I've never smelled those beautiful little bluebells, but I highly doubt they smell like red roses mixed with twice the clove.<br />
<br />
I grew to like it, but it's not the one I reach for regularly.  Mostly it becomes tempting on a cold day when I'm just running errands alone.  I wear it when I'm alone because, to be frank, I worry that others might be offended by it.<br />
<br />
As for any mention of green notes and fresh gardens, I smell not one single trace of those things.  It's more like grandma's stuffy, dusty attic or an old bowl of rose potpourri.<br />
<br />
Test this one before you buy it!<br />
<br />
UPDATE:  I must be fair and add this.  As I said above, this becomes tempting on cold days.  I wore it on a cold, rainy day recently...and it becomes quite magical.  The cloves die down and it becomes a warm, rosy cloud.  I can see how this could remind people of England.  This scent would be great for those foggy/damp days that they have.  But I must stand by my original statement that this does not remind me of fresh gardens or anything green.  The only plant to be found in here is moss.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="112950"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=112950#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent106314" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc88320" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sherapop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sherapop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-L-Eau-38543.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38543.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"title="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma88320ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd88320" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027">sherapop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-07-04">07/04/10 10:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like the greenish-tinged floral opening of Penhaligon BLUEBELL, though I am not at all sure what bluebells smell like and so cannot say whether this abstraction resonates with reality or not.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately, the cloves become stronger in the approach to the drydown, making this floral green a bit heavy and less natural smelling to me the longer it develops. I'm sensitive to cloves anyway, and I certainly have never smelled them in a grassy field of flowers. BLUEBELL might work better in cooler weather, so I'll try again at a later date--today it's 92F! I definitely had a better reaction to this composition last night, when the temperature hovered in the high seventies.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="88320"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=88320#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent85402" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc85402" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Justyna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27220"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.27220.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Justyna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/La-Fin-Du-Monde-20448.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20448.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Fin Du Monde"title="La Fin Du Monde"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma85402ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd85402" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/27220">Justyna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-06-16">06/16/10 01:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not THAT horrid in my opinion. On my skin (after the first cold wave, chemical indeed) it turns into cloves and this spicy note is sexy in a way, sharp but calming. It remains bitter-sweet, like some medicine, perfect for April mornings and hot days as well, mainly for work. I find it unique and... smart (yes, some perfumes smell of intelligence!).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="85402"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=85402#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent72621" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc72621" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gosha"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15283"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.15283.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gosha" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boucheron/Jaipur-Bracelet-14617.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14617.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jaipur Bracelet"title="Jaipur Bracelet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma72621ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd72621" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15283">Gosha</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-03-20">03/20/10 14:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really wanted to sample this, because I adore this shade of blue and think that this bottle combined with the name is soooo pretty! However, I am not usually fond of floral fragrances - could never quite say why exactly - but the (to me very long) opening of this fragrance gives me some clues: they just seem to be lacking some dimension, I think I am missing some  musky or "animalistic" or spicy or powdery or deep notes, something lingering on your skin. They often seem to be pretty and frivolous and that's about it. :-D. For the first hour (or quite a bit more) all I smell here is the hyacinth and nothing else. No citruses or spices or green notes whatsoever, and the scent is not necessarily bad, but seems a little too simple/straightforward and monotonous after a while. I don't have anything really negative to say about it - it is indeed, fresh, spring flowers, pretty and optimistic. I dont mind wearing the sample and could see myself wearing it...hm...say couple of times in a year...? But wait! That was before the hyacinth aroma suddenly disappears and I finally start smelling different notes. I can't say what it is, really, but it's rather delicious and soooo nice - I have tried it a few times just to make sure my senses are not playing up, because it's quite bizarre: the story is always the same - first hour or more pure hyacinth, quite plain and shallow, really and then suddenly when I think that the fragrance is not detectable any more, I start sniffing those beautiful notes - I have virtually walked around sniffing, trying to find out what the lovely smell is until realising that it's me!  So would I buy a bottle? Hm...maybe a tiny one  to use it every now and then as I might to want to experience this transformation again...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="72621"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=72621#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent66386" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc66386" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eilismaireg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/21932"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.21932.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eilismaireg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-19-Eau-de-Parfum-12345.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12345.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 19 Eau de Parfum"title="Chanel No 19 Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma66386ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd66386" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/21932">eilismaireg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-02-11">02/11/10 13:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bah! Horrid!! I was sold on the marketing and bought it from the lovely boutique in London before my wedding. I wore it on the day and luckily my bouquet (Hyacinths &amp; Peonies) eclipsed it. It smells nothing like the English countryside!! I live below a native bluebell wood and they smell very delicate. This is full on synthetic garden hyacinth and my husband hated it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="66386"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=66386#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent45109" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc45109" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mals86"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8430"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8430.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mals86" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Jacobs/Daisy-1361.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1361.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Daisy"title="Daisy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma45109ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd45109" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8430">Mals86</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-09-09">09/09/09 13:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love nearly all the notes listed for this perfume - including the sometimes-difficult galbanum and cloves - and was really excited to open a sample vial, especially when the first whiff was a very realistic hyacinth, just like the ones I bury my nose in every spring.<br />
<br />
Unfortunately, the spicy goodness of hyacinth dissipated within fifteen minutes, leaving behind a very synthetic-smelling, chemical-nightmare shrieking mess.  It's rare that I can't suffer through the whole scent trajectory of a perfume I'm testing, but I couldn't stand Bluebell after an hour and had to wash it off.<br />
<br />
I'll point out that it may simply be my skin reacting badly to the scent, but I did find this horrendous.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="45109"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=45109#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent39181" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc39181" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tessture"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tessture" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/I-Profumi-di-Firenze/Acqua-Mirabile-Odorosa-di-Firenze-9765.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9765.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Acqua Mirabile Odorosa di Firenze "title="Acqua Mirabile Odorosa di Firenze "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma39181ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd39181" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2719">tessture</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-07-15">07/15/09 13:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>hyacinth, white lily and forest floors. With a little spice. Strange and complex while still feeling like a little girls' scent. CaraMia is right: without the spice and an addition of moss or cedar, this would be a garden in the shade of huge ancient trees. As it is right now, the spice makes it odd. Not bad, and actually very interesting, but odd.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="39181"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=39181#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent32199" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc32199" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hathor"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10628"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10628.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hathor" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Instant-de-Guerlain-Eau-de-Toilette-14314.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14314.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Instant de Guerlain Eau de Toilette"title="L'Instant de Guerlain Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma32199ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd32199" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10628">hathor</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-05-07">05/07/09 17:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this perfume smells like the english countryside in late may after a shower of rain. wore it once on such an evening with a blue linen dress, it was just perfect. just seemed to blend in with the whole picture of an english village on a summer evening with the rain just gone and a bit of mist rising.you have to be in the right mood for it, sometimes i really don't like it. don't use it when you've got hay fever!! it is a smell that seems to follow you around. maybe my bottle is getting old, but i can't smell the citrus top note at all, with me it goes over very quickly to cloves and cinnamon, and hyacinths that are going over a bit, kept in a vase too long. a strange, rather eccentric sort of smell. my father liked it very much.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="32199"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=32199#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent30917" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc30917" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CaraMia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/4703"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="CaraMia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Olivier-Strelli/Olivier-Strelli-2413.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2413.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Olivier Strelli"title="Olivier Strelli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma30917ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd30917" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/4703">CaraMia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-04-26">04/26/09 18:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fascinating scent. The opening is sharp citrus and heavy duty springtime hyacinth. The middle is a complete floral bouquet and almost hothousey(if there is such a word) and the ending is a combination of a very green galbanum melded with cinnamon and clove. <br />
<br />
So it starts out like spring then brings you back inside for a spicy cider.<br />
<br />
In a perfect world, I'd dump the spice and and add a bit of moss or cedar.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="30917"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=30917#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent26451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2287">coco76</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2009-03-15">03/15/09 17:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm suprised I could even put this near my skin what with the Hyacinth note (its pretty much my most HATED note) but I could not smell it. I don't know what a Bluebell physically smells like (although I found quite an interesting article about the disappearance of Bluebells in their native Britain, and conservation attempts of this beautiful flower)but I found this perfume to be suprisingly 'spicy'. I'm sure it must be a combination of the cloves and cinammon, but I was surprised to even see cinammon listed in the notes! Although this is a beautiful scent i'm not sure its for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="26451"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=26451#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent16576" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; The dry down is more like perfume, but the opening is evocative and lovely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="16576"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=16576#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1102766" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carrillatta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005897"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1005897.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carrillatta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/First-776.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.776.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="First"title="First"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1102766ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1102766" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1005897">Carrillatta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-10-01">10/01/19 07:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I do love this one, it is unique, strong and long-lasting. Hyacinth is very much a spring flower but I like this in the fall just as well. Nice and green.  Totally different from anything else in my (large) collection.<br />
<br />
Is it a crowd-pleaser?  I don't care much.  I wear this to work on days when I have a lot of writing to get done and feel a need for solitude.  It is my "leave me alone, I am going to be awesome today" perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1102766"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1102766#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent565744" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc565744" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ginnywho"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/328556"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.328556.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ginnywho" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma565744ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd565744" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/328556">ginnywho</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-02-05">02/05/15 16:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Old vase water from rotting flowers initially comes to mind at first whiff, and that very thought ran through my head when I spritzed this on. After a few moments, I started to smile and wondered "What IS this potion?" I find it so hard to describe but impressions such as cold, formal, old, young, bitter, restrained, stuffy, embalmed, inhibited, fresh, haunting, spring, subdued, proper, and ladylike ran through my head. The putrid old vase water was gone and I was left stumped for words, which for me is a rarity if not miraculous. Left me shaking my head, but still smiling. Final impression: contradictory. Maybe that's why I like it, because it dances to its own tune. Tut tut well done, old chap!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="565744"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=565744#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1527417" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1527417" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alphairone"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213298"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1213298.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alphairone" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Claudio-La-Viola/La-Lettera-Da-43914.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43914.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Lettera Da..."title="La Lettera Da..."></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1527417ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1527417" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1213298">alphairone</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-21">03/21/22 06:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I smell hyacinths in all their full, unfettered glory here with Bluebell. Their unapologetic stemmy, sharp greenness that opens the senses, the dewy, floral splendor, and their spicy, cinnamic undertones. I find it to be the ultimate hyacinth soliflore, which may very well be off-putting to those who may want their hyacinth to be tamed and relegated to supporting player, maybe even a walk-on appearance. <br />
<br />
Here it steals the show, for better or worse, but for that I adore it. I truly believe some folks may not have had the pleasure of experiencing hyacinths and their fragrance up close and personal, or maybe they would be put off by them and therefore be put off by Bluebell, which is all fine and good. Stop sniffing hyacinth-centric scents, then. It may not necessarily be the fragrance, it may just be youLuca! In all seriousness, if it were just Princess Diana and me who enjoyed Bluebell, then I'd just be fine with that. Happy Spring!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="1527417"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=1527417#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent913084" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc913084" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mim"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11492"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.11492.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mim" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Putain-des-Palaces-4521.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4521.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Putain des Palaces"title="Putain des Palaces"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma913084ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd913084" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/11492">Mim</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-02-18">02/18/18 11:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was very much afraid of this perfume. Reading all the toilet, swamp water and saliva comparisons, I didn't want to have anything to do with it. However, being a Penhaligon's lover, I got it as a gift. It is a very unusual, natural fragrance. To me, it smells somehow Gothic, like a perfume made for a witch. <br />
I smell some fresh bluebells with stems, roots and leaves. Nothing too pretty but very realistic, I would say. Also, I get a fair amount of wet soil and moist air in this one. This note resembles the smell of stale vase water, but the result isn't as bad as I would expect it (it seems that it only adds to the fragrance's authenticity). Staying power is above 10 hours on my skin; sillage is moderate for the first few hours. Lovely.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="4535"comment_id="913084"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/Bluebell-4535.html?ccid=913084#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="4535" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
